12:30.race_name: Happy New Year From Ayr Racecourse Maiden Hurdle (Go North Night Nurse Hurdle Series Qualifier)(GBB)

runners.comment: Course bumper winner who could improve upon his hurdle debut third at Carlisle
runners.name: Blofeld
runners.spotlight: Convincing win on debut in bumper here (2m, heavy) in February and he shaped as though he would improve for the run when third at Carlisle (2m3f, soft) in November on his first hurdle start; not ruled out.

runners.comment: 2nd in 2 novice h'dles at Carlisle; another place is probably the best outcome to hope for
runners.name: Canunclecani
runners.spotlight: He's improved since finishing fifth in this last year, filling second in two novice hurdles at Carlisle (2m1f/2m3f, soft); however, another place is probably the best outcome to hope for.

runners.comment: Useful in bumpers in early 2024; absent since but major player if retaining old ability
runners.name: Coco Masterpiece
runners.spotlight: 3m point winner for this trainer in March 2022 and showed considerable ability for Willie Mullins in bumpers in early 2024 (soft to heavy); absent since but he's a major player on this hurdle debut if retaining his old ability; trainer won this last year; a hood goes on; watch the market.

runners.comment: Promising fourth in a bumper here but unable to threaten on his two hurdle starts
runners.name: Coylton King
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth in bumper here (2m, soft) last January on second start but unable to threaten on his two hurdle starts (2m/2m3f, soft).

runners.comment: Went close at Hexham last month on second hurdle start and could be thereabouts once more
runners.name: Cushendun
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in bumpers here (2m, good to soft/soft) and he took a step forward on his second hurdle start when going close at Hexham (2m4f, heavy) last month; could be thereabouts once more.

runners.comment: Third in bumper/maiden hurdle; type to improve, especially now up in trip
runners.name: Kings Champion
runners.spotlight: Promising third in Ffos Las bumper (2m, good to soft) in April on sole run for Paul Nicholls and filled the same position on hurdle/stable debut at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) in November; he's the type to improve, especially now up in trip, and he's firmly in calculations.

runners.comment: Failed to threaten in his three Irish maiden points and same story in two maiden hurdles
runners.name: Rock On Max
runners.spotlight: Failed to threaten in his three Irish maiden points and same story in two maiden hurdles towards the end of last year; others preferred.

runners.comment: New trainer has done very well with stable-switchers in recent months; one to consider
runners.name: Saint Malinas
runners.spotlight: Won Irish maiden point (3m, heavy) on debut in February 2024 and showed promise in defeat in maiden hurdles last winter on his two runs for the now-retired Pauline Robson (2m4f/2m3f, soft/good to soft), albeit not looking straightforward on the second occasion; his new trainer has done very well with stable-switchers in recent months and he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Runner-up in a bumper and two maiden hurdles and he's a leading contender today
runners.name: Sleedagh
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Perth bumper (2m, good to soft) in April and also second in two maiden hurdles this season (2m4f/3m, soft/good to soft); all of his rules form reads well and he's a leading contender today.

runners.comment: British point winner who also showed promise on hurdle debut; might not be far away
runners.name: Solid Performer
runners.spotlight: Won British maiden point (3m, good to firm) on debut in April and also showed promise when third of four on hurdle debut at Kelso (2m5f, soft) in November; open to improvement and he might not be far away.

runners.comment: Has shown some ability but others possess stronger form
runners.name: Wherearethejudges
runners.spotlight: He's raced twice and has shown some ability in a British point (2m4f, good) and a novice hurdle at Carlisle (2m3f, soft), but others possess stronger form.

13:00.race_name: Cheltenham Gold Cup Lunch @westernhousehotel Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Disappointing 11 days ago when not jumping well but he's a player on his previous promise
runners.name: Abbey Scope
runners.spotlight: Debut bumper winner (2m, good) who was a promising third at Market Rasen (2m, good to soft) in November on his first hurdle start; didn't jump well when soundly beaten at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft) 11 days ago but he's a contender if finding greater fluency this afternoon.

runners.comment: Seventh foal; dam point/2m4f hurdle winner (RPR 129); he may be best watched on debut
runners.name: Giveitsomewellie
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; dam point/2m4f hurdle winner (RPR 129), half-sister to bumper/hurdle winner Stolberg (123); he may be best watched on debut.

runners.comment: Has shown ability in a point and a bumper and he's not ruled out on his hurdle debut
runners.name: Johnny Moonshine
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, good to yielding) in March and again showed ability when fourth in a bumper at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) in November; open to improvement and not ruled out on hurdle debut.

runners.comment: 33-1 and always towards the rear on last month's debut in a bumper here
runners.name: Johnny Two Jets
runners.spotlight: 5,000euros 3yo who was 33-1 and always towards the rear on last month's debut in a bumper here (2m, heavy); dramatic improvement needed.

runners.comment: Runner-up in bumper on debut in May but tailed off over C&D on both hurdle starts
runners.name: Larme De Bonheur
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in Uttoxeter bumper (good) in May for Tom George but tailed off for this yard on both hurdle starts (C&D, soft/heavy).

runners.comment: Second in Ballinrobe bumper; contender if reproducing that promise on hurdle/stable debut
runners.name: Largy Meadow
runners.spotlight: 6-1, bumped into a useful, easy winner when second on debut in bumper at Ballinrobe (1m7f, good) in July; subsequently sold out of Stuart Crawford's yard for 29,000gns; he's a contender if reproducing that bumper promise on this hurdle and stable debut.

runners.comment: Encouraging fourth on last month's debut over C&D and he's one to be interested in
runners.name: Like Minded
runners.spotlight: 28-1 when keeping on for fourth, beaten about 12l, on last month's debut over C&D (heavy); he may come into his own when tackling further but is still of interest today for last year's winning yard.

runners.comment: Placed on two of his three starts in France and could play a leading role on stable debut
runners.name: Locquirec
runners.spotlight: Placed over hurdles on two of his three starts in France (2m1f, very soft); his latest effort in September reads well and he could play a leading role on this stable debut, for which he wears a tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Tailed off/pulled up on first two starts
runners.name: Plane Sailing
runners.spotlight: Only 11-4 for debut in bumper at Hexham (2m, good) in April but tailed off, and pulled up at 150-1 on recent hurdle debut at Kelso (2m, soft).

runners.comment: Course bumper winner who was 3rd over hurdles at Kelso last month and is high on the list
runners.name: Sanilam
runners.owner: J Fyffe And Mrs W Duffus
runners.spotlight: Course bumper winner (2m, soft) who took a step in the right direction with 7l third at Kelso (2m, soft) last month on his second hurdle start, when not helped by a mistake two out and losing a shoe; high on the list.

runners.comment: Not devoid of ability thus far but may be of greater interest when upped in trip in h'caps
runners.name: Whathaveyou
runners.spotlight: Not devoid of ability in a bumper and C&D novice hurdle on his first two runs but he may be of greater interest when upped in trip in handicaps.

runners.comment: Very disappointing on hurdle debut; wind op since; could tap back into bumper promise
runners.name: Wilstar
runners.spotlight: Very disappointing favourite on hurdle/seasonal debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in November; however, he's had a wind op since and wears a first-time tongue-tie, and he could tap back into the considerable promise shown when winning a bumper at Perth in April (2m, good to soft; unraced on softer).

runners.comment: Trainer won this in 2023 and 2024, but she's been well beaten on both hurdle starts
runners.name: Zhanma Enki
runners.spotlight: She's one to watch in the betting for a trainer who won this in 2023 and 2024; however, she's been well beaten on both hurdle starts (2m/2m5f, heavy/soft) and needs to leave those performances miles behind.

13:30.race_name: Karaoke At The Golf Inn Prestwick Novices' Handicap Chase (Go North Forgive 'N Forget Series) (GBB)

runners.comment: Form dipped over C&D on reappearance but he's normally consistent and may rebound
runners.name: Rock On Jet
runners.spotlight: Gained his hurdles win at Ayr; form dipped over C&D on seasonal debut (second chase attempt) but he's normally consistent and may rebound with the outing under his belt.

runners.comment: In decent form judged on his two Kelso runs this term; gained his hurdles win at Ayr
runners.name: Ballyfort
runners.spotlight: In decent form judged on his two Kelso runs this term, although rather a fortuitous winner on reappearance; gained his hurdles win at Ayr and could go well back here.

runners.breeder: Lasnawood Ltd & Tullis Park Rose Ltd
runners.comment: Heavy ground was possibly not ideal last time; retains potential for chasing
runners.name: Southey
runners.spotlight: Last of four finishers over C&D (chase debut) most recently but the heavy ground perhaps wasn't ideal; retains potential for this sphere, having gained sole win in a point.

runners.comment: Justified favouritism at Newcastle last time and is open to further improvement
runners.name: Powerofjet
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism at Newcastle (2m, good to soft) last time, building on his reappearance effort and adding to spring hurdles win; open to further improvement over fences; respected.

runners.comment: Has failed to transfer his hurdles form to chasing; something to prove
runners.name: The Jewellers Pet
runners.spotlight: Recorded his hurdles wins over 2m4f at Ayr last February; has failed to transfer that form to three chase attempts; enough to prove back down in distance.

14:00.race_name: Sunday Lunch At Western House Hotel Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Runner-up in first-time cheekpieces here last time and a likely contender again
runners.name: Forest Blaze
runners.owner: M Blades, Craggs, Clark And Cambridge
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 2m4f at Hexham last season (soft/good to soft) and built upon his reappearance run when second here (2m3f, heavy) in first-time cheekpieces last month; likely contender again.

runners.comment: Out of sorts on both outings this season; cheekpieces removed after one use
runners.name: Eire Street
runners.spotlight: Won twice (once over C&D) on heavy ground in early 2024 but lightly raced since and has looked out of sorts on both outings this season; cheekpieces removed after one use; revival needed.

runners.comment: Won over fences for Dan Skelton in summer 2024; makes stable debut after long absence
runners.name: Don Occhetti
runners.spotlight: Came good for Dan Skelton at ninth attempt, with 7l success over fences at Worcester (2m4f, good) in summer 2024; reverts to hurdling for new stable after long absence and the slower ground is probably not ideal.

runners.comment: Good second here on seasonal/stable debut; not in same form on latest outing
runners.name: Shadow Chaser
runners.spotlight: Creditable second of 14 here (2m3f, soft) on seasonal/stable debut in November; big player if judged on that performance but wasn't in same form at Carlisle last month and is now 0-8 over hurdles.

runners.comment: Ended last season in poor form over fences and made low-key return over hurdles last month
runners.name: Raceview Road
runners.spotlight: Ended last season in poor form over fences and was towards rear throughout when back over hurdles last month; might have needed that recent run but still has quite a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Yet to transfer bumper promise to hurdles but remains unexposed; cheekpieces added today
runners.name: Parish Quiz
runners.spotlight: Yet to transfer last season's bumper promise to hurdles but remains very unexposed and is open to improvement if aided by first first-time cheekpieces on this handicap debut.

runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles but was clear second on last month's seasonal debut; respected
runners.name: Big Storm Brewing
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles but was clear second on last month's seasonal debut at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) and a recent 3lb rise ought to be manageable if he's in the same form here; high on the list.

runners.comment: Very lightly raced in recent years; back from latest layoff with poor chase run last month
runners.name: Zumbi
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced in recent years and returned from latest layoff with a poor chase run last month; very well handicapped on old form but needs to prove some ability remains; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.comment: Second on handicap debut in spring but returned from break with three lesser autumn runs
runners.name: Burning It Up
runners.spotlight: Kept on for second behind progressive rival on handicap debut at Perth (2m4f, good to soft) in April but returned from break with three lesser efforts in the autumn, and was particularly disappointing when made favourite over 3m last time; drops back in trip with a point to prove.

runners.comment: Won this in 2023 and was placed last year; latest attempt comes after good run last month
runners.name: So Many Roads
runners.spotlight: Yet to add to his win in 2023 edition of this race but quite lightly raced in the meantime and gave good account when third here (2m3f, heavy; just behind Forest Blaze) last month; now 5lb lower than when placed in this race last year; must be considered.

runners.comment: Point winner; only minor promise in 2m novice hurdles; up in trip for handicap debut
runners.name: The Coffey Boy
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner last February (soft); showed only minor promise in three 2m novice hurdles here (soft/heavy) in the autumn but will be suited by this step up in trip and is open to improvement in handicaps.

runners.comment: Safely held when fifth on handicap debut; drops back from 2m7f with headgear switched
runners.name: Carrhill
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer who was safely held when fifth of eight on recent handicap debut at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces); drops back in trip and tries a visor today; improvement required.

runners.breeder: Elevage Av Lozach Le Yan & G Defontaine
runners.comment: Well beaten on all three starts for new stable towards end of last year; cheekpieces added
runners.name: En Avant
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner for Olly Murphy in 2023 but well beaten on all three starts for new stable towards end of last year and needs a huge boost from the new cheekpieces here.

runners.comment: Ended last year with two respectable runs here but others appeal more
runners.name: Velvet Vulcan
runners.spotlight: Won off basement Flat mark for Mike Murphy last summer (2m, AW) and ended last year with two respectable hurdle runs here for this stable (2m/2m3f) but others appeal more all the same.

runners.comment: Ran well over fences here in November but has a modest strike-rate
runners.name: Lewa House
runners.spotlight: 10yo with modest 1-28 strike-rate; ran well in 3m chase here (soft) on seasonal debut in November but was not in same form in very similar event here last month; not the percentage call.

runners.comment: Course winner in first-time visor just under a year ago but yet to build on that success
runners.name: Boolamore Classic
runners.spotlight: Opened account with narrow course win (2m5f, soft) in first-time visor just under a year ago but yet to build on that success; drops back in trip after looking stetched by 3m on heavy ground here last month (ran well for a long way) but others have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Has not shown a great deal on her two starts this season and is now 0-8 over hurdles
runners.name: Breadalbane Lass
runners.spotlight: Placed in first-time cheekpiees at Carlisle (2m1f, good to soft) last February but has not shown a great deal on her two appearances this season (2m3f/1m7f) and is now 0-8 over hurdles.

runners.comment: Safely held over 2m3f here on consecutive outings in late 2025; now 0-6 over hurdles
runners.name: Bray Dale
runners.spotlight: Belied 80-1 odds when staying on for modest third here (2m, soft) on handicap debut last March but was safely held over 2m3f here on both starts towards end of last year.

runners.comment: C&D winner in 2023 but has not been firing on all cylinders for a good while now
runners.name: Euchan Falls
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D in 2023 but has not been firing on all cylinders for a good while now and makes very limited appeal from 4lb out of the weights.

14:30.race_name: Book Wicked Afternoon Tea @westernhousehotel Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.comment: Back to form when fourth at Newcastle and he's respected now back down in grade
runners.name: Wal Bucks
runners.spotlight: Won at Haydock (3m1f, soft) in December 2024 and he returned to form with a front-running fourth at Newcastle (3m6f, good to soft) last time; this 7yo could still have more to offer and is respected back down in grade.

runners.comment: Promising chase debut here; disappointing at Wetherby since but could bounce back today
runners.name: Visual Impact
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in maiden hurdle here (3m, soft) last January and promising third on chase debut here (2m4f, soft) in November; disappointing at Wetherby (3m, soft) since but could have a part to play if that was just a blip.

runners.comment: Improvement needed on third chase start but he's well handicapped on his hurdle form
runners.name: Dangerous Touch
runners.spotlight: Has jumped to the right and lacked fluency when soundly beaten this term on first two chase starts; however, he's in good hands and well handicapped on his hurdle form, and things may click over fences at some point.

runners.comment: 13l win over C&D on third chase start; a 10lb rise may not stop him if he can back that up
runners.name: Wholly Boley
runners.spotlight: Point winner who returned to form with a bang for 13l win over C&D (heavy) last month on third chase start, with trainer reporting he was suited by the softer ground; a 10lb rise may not stop him if he can back that up.

runners.comment: 12yo who is without a win since December 2023 but he showed spark at Carlisle last time
runners.name: Bushypark
runners.spotlight: 12yo who is without a win since December 2023 but he ran his best race for some time when fourth at Carlisle (3m2f, soft) 33 days ago and is another 2lb lower today; this front-runner is not ruled out each-way.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Denki
runners.comment: 10yo who needs a return to form but he's 2lb lower than for his C&D win last January
runners.name: Travail Dorfevre
runners.spotlight: Now 2lb lower than when winning in small field over C&D (soft) last January; this 10yo hasn't shone since but could improve for November's reappearance run here and is not discounted in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Impressive over 2m4f at Carlisle latest and 7lb rise could be lenient; stamina in pedigree
runners.name: Celestial Fashion
runners.spotlight: Runner-up last winter on first three chase starts and reappeared with 10l win in mares' chase at Carlisle (2m4f, soft) in November; won here over hurdles; tackles a new trip today but there's stamina in her pedigree and a 7lb rise for last time could prove lenient.

runners.comment: C&D winner who was third at Musselburgh last month; return to left-handed track could suit
runners.name: Cowboy Cooper
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (good to soft) last February and returned to form with 7l third at Musselburgh (2m7f, soft) last month on his second start of the season; the return to a left-handed track could suit; one to consider.

runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Won at 14-1 over C&D in November following a break but pulled up at Carlisle since
runners.name: Azof Des Mottes
runners.spotlight: Won at 14-1 over C&D (soft) in November following a break and the return to Ayr could be a positive, but he's inconsistent and it's hard to be confident today after he was pulled up at Carlisle (3m2f, soft) last time.

runners.comment: 22-1 winner at Hexham two starts ago but this 12yo was well beaten otherwise last year
runners.name: Eveque
runners.spotlight: 12yo who won at 22-1 at Hexham (3m, good to soft) in November; however, well beaten on his three other runs last year, most recently at Sedgefield last month, and others are more solid.

runners.comment: Stayed on well for third over 3m2f last time and he's open to further improvement
runners.name: Auchinlek
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well for third of 12 at Carlisle (3m2f, soft) last time, despite a bad early mistake on that third chase start; the drop back in trip seems a likely negative but this unexposed 7yo is open to further improvement.

runners.comment: Third over C&D last time but needs something extra if he's to get off the mark today
runners.name: Joie More
runners.spotlight: Hasn't run badly on his last two starts, most recently third over C&D (heavy), but he was no match for the winner Wholly Boley and remains a maiden after 11 rules starts; 3lb out of the handicap and needs something extra.

runners.comment: Third at Sedgefield last month and should be fine back up to 3m, but 4lb out of the h'cap
runners.name: Cave Hill
runners.spotlight: Won at Hexham (2m4f, good to soft) in May on third chase start and kept on for third at Sedgefield (2m5f, soft) last month; the return to 3m should be fine but he needs a career-best effort from 4lb out of the handicap.

runners.comment: The slower ground could help but plenty to prove from miles out of the handicap
runners.name: Whispering Dancer
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m, heavy) who is very lightly raced under rules and attracted market support when tailed off on his chase and handicap debut at Hexham (3m, good to soft) in November; today's forecast slower ground could help but he has plenty to prove from miles out of the handicap.

15:00.race_name: Quiz Night At Golf Inn Prestwick Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Has struggled over hurdles on last 2 runs and didn't look a natural in sole previous chase
runners.name: Johnsons Blue
runners.spotlight: Short-headed over hurdles at Hexham (2m4f, good to soft) in June and he's just 1lb higher today; however, he struggled over hurdles on both runs since and he didn't look a natural on his sole previous chase start.

runners.comment: Three novice hurdle wins; promise in both chases; improvement is possible now up in trip
runners.name: Junker Dallier
runners.spotlight: Three novice hurdle wins last season (2m1f/2m, soft/good to soft) and promise this season on first two chase starts, close third of five in beginners' chase at Carlisle (2m, soft) last time; improvement is possible now up in trip on his first handicap start and he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Something to prove over fences but well handicapped on hurdle form and yard is going well
runners.name: Jipcot
runners.spotlight: Record of U7F3 over fences (in 2023) and he struggled in hot handicap hurdles on final two starts last spring; however, he's well handicapped on his best hurdle form and reappears with his yard going very well; not discounted.

runners.comment: Won on chase debut then faced tough task at Cheltenham; could go well back in a handicap
runners.name: Cloonainra
runners.spotlight: Improved form when winning on chase debut in mares' novice at Listowel (2m3f, yielding) in September; also effective on soft ground; well beaten at Cheltenham since but that was a hot novice; unexposed over fences and could have a part to play now back in a handicap.

runners.breeder: Philippe Thiriet & S C E A Haras De Pey
runners.comment: Drops back in grade for this return to fences but others have more compelling claims
runners.name: Karafon
runners.spotlight: Ex-Willie Mullins 6yo; not devoid of promise over hurdles on his two runs for this yard and he's dropping down the weights, while he drops back in grade for this return to fences; however, he failed to shine on his sole previous chase start and others have more compelling claims.

runners.comment: Lightly raced & could play a leading role if finding greater fluency on second chase start
runners.name: Captain Butler
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced point, bumper and maiden hurdle winner who was a promising second over hurdles here (2m4f, soft) in November on stable debut; didn't jump well when well beaten on last month's chase debut at Aintree (2m4f, soft) but could play a leading role if finding greater fluency today.

runners.comment: Clear second on last month's chase debut at Kelso and could have more to offer over fences
runners.name: Young Jack
runners.owner: D & D Armstrong Ltd & L Westwood
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent over hurdles last season but this point winner was suited by the switch to fences when a clear second of five to an improved winner on his reappearance at Kelso (2m7f, soft) last month; he could have more to offer in this sphere and goes on the shortlist.

runners.breeder: P Noue & S A R L Ecurie Silgezam
runners.comment: Hasn't kicked on from 2023 promise but it's possible things will click again today
runners.name: Great Pepper
runners.spotlight: 8yo who has had an interrupted and predominantly underwhelming career since winning four in a row in 2023 (two points and two novice hurdles); however, he attracted market support at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) last Friday when unseating at the sixth fence, which appeared to be caused by a stumble; his trainer has had a 9-1 winner and a 33-1 runner-up of late; interesting.

runners.comment: Missed 2025 but this point winner could relish switch to fences; potential off this mark
runners.name: Big John Wayne
runners.spotlight: Missed all of 2025, having shown plenty of ability in novice hurdles in 2024; this point winner could relish the switch to fences and he has plenty of potential off his opening mark if retaining his previous promise.

runners.comment: Promising novice hurdler in 2023-24 campaign; absent since but not ruled out on comeback
runners.name: Milcree
runners.spotlight: Promising novice hurdler in the 2023-24 campaign; this 8yo has been absent since but he's a chasing type who could be on a good mark and his trainer had an excellent November and December.

15:30.race_name: Golf Inn Prestwick For The Ayr Stayers Trophy Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hdl Series Qual)

runners.comment: Ran mighty race from the front on last hurdle start and capable of a very bold bid
runners.name: Phantomofthepoints
runners.owner: Mrs Jo Tracey, K Alexander, P&S Bryceland
runners.spotlight: Ran a mighty race from the front when third of 17 in hot handicap hurdle at Haydock (3m, good to soft) on reappearance; also effective on soft; fell on chase debut since and capable of very bold bid back hurdling.

runners.comment: No match for first two at Sandown last time but this may take less winning; chance
runners.name: Ikarak
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing & Mrs D J Brown
runners.spotlight: Two wins last term and reappeared with another at Lingfield (2m7f, good to soft) in November; no match for first two when third at Sandown (2m7f, soft) since but those were progressive rivals and this may take less winning.

runners.comment: Runner-up to improving winner over C&D on last hurdle start; could have a part to play
runners.name: Whistle Stop Tour
runners.owner: Mrs Jo Tracey, K Alexander, P&S Bryceland
runners.spotlight: Merely fifth on his two chase starts this season but in between he was second over hurdles over this C&D (soft), sandwiched by a winner/third who have both won since; could have a part to play now back hurdling.

runners.comment: In fine form since joining this yard; climbing the weights but he's clearly thriving
runners.name: Authorized Mission
runners.spotlight: Bolted up on stable debut at Kelso (2m5f, good to soft) in November and came clear with a progressive winner there (extended 2m6f, soft) next time; another 5lb higher today but clearly thriving; respected.

runners.comment: Pulled up on both starts last year, following a very long absence
runners.name: Baptism Of Fire
runners.spotlight: Hurdle/chase winner for Henry de Bromhead but tailed off in June 2022 on final run for that yard, prior to very long absence; pulled up for this stable on his two starts last year and very hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Out of form but wind surgery has done the trick in the past; runner-up in this last year
runners.name: Gaillimh A Stor
runners.spotlight: Hard to win with and out of form on both runs this term; however, he's had wind surgery since, which has done the trick in the past, and he's 3lb lower than when second in this last year (soft); could be thereabouts.

runners.comment: Relished the step up to 2m7f to make winning handicap debut; could have more to offer
runners.name: Highland Fashion
runners.spotlight: Relished the step up in trip to make winning handicap debut at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft) in November; also effective on soft ground; 4lb higher in a hotter race today but unexposed and could have more to offer.

runners.breeder: Suc Magalen Bryant, Mr Denis Baer & Suc
runners.comment: On a handy mark but tailed off here on stable debut in November
runners.name: Imaginary Dragon
runners.owner: Ms N J Grieve & C A Turner
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner who showed spark over fences here last January and is on a handy mark, but he was pulled up in February on his final run for Sandy Thomson and tailed off when back over hurdles on his stable debut in November; cheekpieces go on; plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Tailed off at Kelso last month but three wins here, including two starts ago in November
runners.name: Follow Charlie
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent sort who is untested at the trip and was tailed off at Kelso last month; however, he's won three times here, including two starts ago in November (2m4f, soft), and he's not written off now back at Ayr.

runners.comment: 11yo who has tumbled down the weights but for good reason
runners.name: Coconut Splash
runners.spotlight: He's tumbled down the weights but this 11yo was soundly beaten on his two starts towards the end of 2025, following a long absence.

runners.comment: Won at 2m1f last time and unraced beyond 2m5f, but this trip could be within range
runners.name: Fostered Phil
runners.spotlight: Won at Perth (2m4f, good) in September and back on the scoresheet at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) latest, by 7l; this 12yo is unraced beyond 2m5f but stayed on well over that trip at Kelso in October; each-way possibilities.

12:42.race_name: CCR "Hands And Heels" Apprentice Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Series)

runners.comment: Unlucky in running in a stronger C&D handicap latest; of obvious interest at this level
runners.name: Charlie Mason
runners.spotlight: Better than ever in the second half of 2025, winning at Doncaster in September and running well in four handicaps since; just making his move when short of room in a valuable event over C&D 15 days ago and treated as being in top form still; solid claims for a rider who has made a flying start to her career.

runners.comment: Behind Charlie Mason here two weeks ago; solid 3rd on Sunday; others are more appealing
runners.name: Em Four
runners.spotlight: Finished behind Charlie Mason over C&D 15 days ago; back in form when third of eight at Southwell on Sunday; should run his race but others are more appealing for win purposes.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two handicaps following a wide-margin novice win on turf; still low mileage
runners.name: Express Train
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin win in a 6f novice at Leicester last July on his third start; that form hasn't worked out and he has been well beaten in two handicaps himself; needs to leave last month's return to action behind him but he's low mileage and in good hands so that is possible.

runners.comment: Out of form this winter but drops in class and tries a visor; betting likely to guide
runners.name: Nazron
runners.spotlight: Well treated on even last summer's best; had wind surgery in August and he has finished out the back in three runs this winter, including tried in cheekpieces last time; now has a visor fitted and drops into a Class 5; revival likely to be predicted by the betting.

runners.comment: Not at his best in either run this winter but has still fared okay; on last winning mark
runners.name: Distant Rumble
runners.spotlight: Not at his best in two runs back from a 116-day absence but neither run was without hope and he is back to his last winning mark; promising apprentice booked; revival possible.

runners.comment: Yet to win on AW but effective here and handicapper has given him a chance; yard run two
runners.name: Merrimack
runners.spotlight: All four wins have come on turf but he is effective at this track; had wide trip when down the field over 5f here latest; better expected today with the handicapper having given him a chance; stable run two here.

runners.comment: 13-race maiden; ran okay over C&D last time but more needed to take this
runners.name: Invincible Melody
runners.spotlight: Still seeking a first win after 13 attempts; on a lowly mark and he ran creditably over C&D four weeks ago; others may have his measure this time though.

runners.comment: On dangerous mark but all wins have been on turf and he looks opposable on return
runners.name: Clansman
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: Six-time turf winner at up to 1m7f but his last success was in April 2024; well treated on old form but he struggled in his final run during the summer and is 0-6 on AW; opposable back from 201 days off.

runners.comment: Returned to Flat with good third here (2m) in November and she's respected back in trip
runners.name: D Day Arvalenreeva
runners.spotlight: Completed a hat-trick over hurdles for Kevin Philippart De Foy in the spring; lost her way in last four hurdle runs but she returned to the Flat with a creditable third here (2m) in November; looks interesting off unchanged mark and she's respected back in trip.

runners.comment: Bolted up at Wolverhampton but he flopped in follow-up bid over C&D three weeks ago
runners.name: Spectacular Style
runners.spotlight: Bolted up under a well-judged ride at Wolverhampton (1m6f) in October; only went up 6lb for that emphatic success but he flopped in his follow-up bid over C&D three weeks ago; has bit to prove again after that and he's not easy to predict.

runners.comment: Easy win at Southwell (1m3f) in April but he's struggled since and has plenty to prove
runners.name: Forca Timao
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of a Southwell handicap (1m3f, Tapeta) in April but that was a four-runner race and he's struggled since; now 2lb lower than for that last success but he has plenty to prove at this new trip.

runners.comment: Dual Tapeta winner but was disappointing here last time and needs to get back near best
runners.name: Gemmari
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m4f on Tapeta at the start of the year; was gelded in the spring but he's not made an impact since returning after an absence in October; still lightly raced but he flopped when favourite here (2m) last time and needs to get back near best.

runners.comment: 0-9 in handicaps but he looks worth another try at this trip; dangerous off sliding mark
runners.name: Hebridean Nomad
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m novice at Kempton in September 2023; record of 0-9 in handicaps since but he's reached the frame five times including an eyecatching third at Kempton (1m3f) on his penultimate run; looks worth another try at this trip and he's in the mix off sliding mark.

runners.comment: 1-12 but he's on dangerous mark and was strong-finishing third over 1m4f latest; respected
runners.name: Different Tone
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 12 starts but he's well handicapped on his best form and was strong at the finish when third at Wolverhampton (1m4f) last month; that form has been boosted by the runner-up since and he's respected back up in trip.

runners.comment: Has record of 12331322 since returned to AW in September and she's a key player
runners.name: Cardinal Point
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Cxxi And Partner
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 12331322 since returned to AW in September and that latest second was behind an improver over C&D three weeks ago; only 1lb higher on this return visit and she still has scope for further progress; key player.

runners.comment: Well beaten in three novice runs as a 3yo; no appeal
runners.name: Lady Of Killarney
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three novice runs as a 3yo; no appeal.

runners.comment: Knocking at the door on Polytrack last month but likely vulnerable to the 3yos
runners.name: Thecoffeepoddotco
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but she has been banging at the door this winter, second over C&D and at Lingfield (6f) last month; likely vulnerable against the 3yos here though.

runners.comment: Ran well dropped to 5f/blinkered last month; drawn wide but high on the list
runners.name: Chhota Saab
runners.spotlight: Collared close home having forced the pace in a 5f novice at Lingfield 16 days ago (blinkered first time); drawn wide but unexposed at 5f and not ruled out.

runners.comment: Not far off her best when second at Wolverhampton last month; e-w shout back on Polytrack
runners.name: Cool Molly
runners.spotlight: Reliable filly who wasn't far off her best when second of ten at Wolverhampton three weeks ago; each-way claims back on Polytrack.

runners.comment: Fair debut but took a backwards step latest; hooded and dropped in trip here; yard run two
runners.name: Curated
runners.spotlight: Debut effort (6f, Polytrack) was okay but she took a backwards step at Southwell 15 days ago (50-1); hood added now dropped in trip; looks the stable second string.

runners.comment: Two promising runs last July; more to come this year and she looks a strong contender
runners.name: Mad Dash
runners.spotlight: Two runs last July, stepping up on her debut fourth (6f, AW) when second of nine at Windsor 17 days later (5f, good); has more to offer this year and looks a leading candidate.

runners.comment: 12,000gns yearling; has 3 winning siblings; dam a Listed-placed 5f winner; check market
runners.name: Mayflyer
runners.spotlight: 7,000gns foal, 12,000gns yearling; eighth foal; closely related to 7f winner Eric Lock (RPR 66), half-sister to winners Perfect Sunrise (Spanish 5.5f/6f including 2yo/AW) and Poetic Hope (Greek 5.5f-7f); dam Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner (including AW; 96); starts out at a modest level and market confidence would look significant.

runners.comment: First foal of a 5f winner; sire more of a stamina influence; market can guide
runners.name: Pure Passion
runners.owner: J W Parry And Mrs C Shekells
runners.spotlight: First foal of a 5f winner (including AW; RPR 78); plenty of speed on dam's side of the pedigree but she is by Magna Grecia so 5f looks a slight query on debut.

14:12.race_name: Chelmsford Mile Series Qualifying Handicap (Chelmsford Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Won here last month and had tough task from wide draw in Class 2 last time; dangerous
runners.name: Dark Side Thunder
runners.spotlight: Recorded his eighth AW win when justifying favouritism with a strong finish here (6f; off 3lb lower) last month; no impact on his return visit two weeks ago but that was from a wide draw in a Class 2 event; now goes back up in trip but he has won over 7f and he's in the mix on this big drop back in grade.

runners.comment: Triple C&D winner but he's lost his way and needs a major revival
runners.name: Riot
runners.spotlight: Triple C&D winner who defied this mark at Wolverhampton in October but he's lost his way since and has finished out the back in both runs for current yard; now drops back into a Class 5 event but this 9yo needs a major revival.

runners.comment: Five-time AW winner who bounced back with good second at Southwell latest; respected
runners.name: Chola Empire
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner who scored over C&D in October and he bounced back with a creditable second at Southwell two weeks ago; remains feasibly treated off only 2lb higher than for his last success and he's respected back on Polytrack.

runners.comment: Eight-time AW winner who chased home an improver over C&D last time; each-way claims
runners.name: Revolutionise
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is an eight-time AW winner including three over C&D; held back on Polytrack in last four starts but he did best of the rest behind an improver here (7f) last time; should get a decent tow into this race and has each-way claims again.

runners.comment: Beat Arantes Nascimento at Lingfield on recent stable debut; big player again up 3lb
runners.name: Me Tarzan
runners.spotlight: Won twice on turf during the summer and he finished placed in his final four runs for James Fanshawe; changed hands for 27,000gns in October; well backed into 4-1 on recent stable debut at Lingfield (7f, AW) and he battled well for a narrow win over Arantes Nascimento; up 3lb but that was a personal best last time and he's open to more progress; key player.

runners.breeder: S C E A Elevage Dyllone
runners.comment: On much-reduced mark but last win was in 2022 and he hasn't threatened this year
runners.name: Wodao
runners.owner: Jim And Claire Ltd And Jon & Kay Collins
runners.spotlight: Very useful in his prime but he hasn't not won since 2022; has dropped a long way in the weights but he hasn't threatened this year and is now 0-14 for current yard; others preferred.

runners.comment: Has struggled since returning from a long absence in July and has lots to prove
runners.name: Space Cowboy
runners.spotlight: Smart form when winning twice on Tapeta as a 2yo but he's been lightly raced since; missed last year and he's struggled since returning from a long absence in July; mark is tumbling but he has a lot to prove.

runners.comment: Sole win was in October 2023 but he went very close behind Me Tarzan at Lingfield latest
runners.name: Arantes Nascimento
runners.spotlight: Sole win was in October 2023; well held in first two runs for current yard but he got back near best with a near miss behind Me Tarzan at Lingfield (7f, AW) two weeks ago; up 3lb but he remains feasibly treated and is respected in this rematch.

runners.comment: Handicap newcomer and he needs a close look on this drop back in trip; blinkers added
runners.name: Shamacid
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in four of his eight starts and the step up to 1m seemed to stretch him in a novice here (fourth of ten) three weeks ago; looks on workable mark now switched to a handicap and has possibilities back in trip; blinkers added.

runners.comment: May improve now handicapping and upped to 1m
runners.name: Aneirins Sword
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced gelding who isn't solid on his 7f form but may improve now handicapping over this extra furlong; half-brother to a 1m winner.

runners.comment: Record of 42211 since wearing cheekpieces; respected assuming he takes as well to a visor
runners.name: Thanh Nam
runners.spotlight: Record of 42211 since wearing cheekpieces, the wins at Chelmsford (1m) and Wolverhampton (8.5f); respected, assuming he sustains the progress in new headgear (now visored).

runners.comment: Related to winners for her yard; open to improvement in handicaps; interesting
runners.name: Urban Law
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced filly who has shown a degree of promise; related to a few winners for her yard and looks open to improvement in handicaps; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Regressed the last twice and remains a maiden
runners.name: Flying Macs
runners.spotlight: Has made the frame a few times but regressed the last twice and remains a maiden; others are less exposed.

runners.comment: May take a step forward now handicapping; market support should be noted
runners.name: Three Socks On
runners.spotlight: Has finished only eighth in maiden races but may take a step forward now handicapping; backed into favouritism on debut and market support should be noted.

runners.comment: Has shown positive signs in handicaps; possibilities if taking well to headgear
runners.name: Reasons Power
runners.spotlight: Has shown positive signs with fourth-place finishes at Kempton (1m) and Wolverhampton (9.5f) since switched to handicap level; possibilities if taking well to first-time headgear.

runners.comment: Has failed to progress in handicaps and needs to raise her game
runners.name: Lapidarist
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who has failed to show progress in handicaps, including in C&D event won by Thanh Nam, and needs to raise her game.

runners.comment: Appeared to improve at Wolverhampton last week on stable debut; future mark 10lb higher
runners.name: Telling Time
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant who is due to go up 10lb in future, having appeared to show improvement in 7f novice event at Wolverhampton last week on debut for new stable; good chance provided that effort is backed up.

runners.comment: Signs of improvement with fourth to Thanh Nam over C&D (handicap debut) last time
runners.name: Chinchin
runners.spotlight: Showed signs of improvement with fourth to Thanh Nam over C&D (handicap debut) last time; that effort gives her something to build on.

15:12.race_name: Chelmsford Mile Series Qualifying Handicap (Chelmsford Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Has dropped a long way in the weights but he's 0-11 for current yard; needs to find more
runners.name: Al Waqidi
runners.spotlight: Ex-Godolphin; returning from a mammoth absence he started the year on a BHA mark of 90 but he's 0-11 for current yard and has plummeted in the weights; finished a fair fifth at Kempton (1m, AW) two weeks ago but he was never dangerous and needs to build on that.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 3yo but she's been disappointing last twice and needs to bounce back
runners.name: Vizzavona Lady
runners.spotlight: 3yo who reappeared with a win at Wolverhampton (7f) in October but she's been disappointing in last two runs; still lightly raced but her form has been up and down and she still has stamina to prove at this trip; others preferred.

runners.comment: Won over C&D before a close second off this mark at Lingfield last month; big player
runners.name: Gladiadora
runners.owner: Mrs R Coleman And G Glendining
runners.spotlight: Just 1-11 on turf but she's had only three runs on AW which include a win over C&D in November and a close second behind Nebula Stars at Lingfield (1m) last month; on same mark as last time and she's a key player back at this track.

runners.comment: Polytrack winner in August and wasn't beaten far on recent stable debut; in the mix
runners.name: Rising Force
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer who scored at Lingfield (1m, AW) in August, in his final run for Robert Eddery; held in fifth on stable debut at Southwell last month but he wasn't beaten far and should be sharper this time; in the mix back on Polytrack.

runners.comment: Has won at Lingfield last twice and is open to more progress; respected in hat-trick bid
runners.name: Arthur Rose
runners.spotlight: No joy in her first 14 starts but she has form figures of 211 for current yard and both those wins have been on Polytrack at Lingfield (1m); up another 4lb but she's on a roll and is open to more progress; strongly respected.

runners.comment: Went close at Lingfield on penultimate run and has claims if he can recapture that form
runners.name: My Boy Harry
runners.spotlight: Two wins this year and latest was at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) in October; resumed his progress with a near miss at Lingfield last month and he had an excuse back at 7f five days later; still looks feasibly treated and has claims if he can recapture his penultimate form.

runners.comment: Cashed in on a reduced mark at Kempton last month and she's respected back up in trip
runners.name: Adace
runners.spotlight: Ended a lengthy losing run when scoring off a reduced mark at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) last month; up 4lb for that narrow success but she was strong at the finish and is respected on this step back up in trip.

runners.comment: In-form 5yo but he needs to find more to get back on the scoresheet
runners.name: First Encounter
runners.spotlight: Reached the frame under front-running tactics on Polytrack (1m) in his last two starts but he's still 5lb higher than for his last win in July and could be vulnerable again in this competitive race.

runners.breeder: Yarraman Park Stud Pty Ltd,Nsw, R Duffic
runners.comment: Beat Gladiadora at Lingfield last month and he's only 1lb higher here; shortlisted
runners.name: Nebula Stars
runners.owner: The Limes Of Epsom Racing Club
runners.spotlight: 1-24 in Hong Kong; returned after long absence in November but he's done well in three runs for his new yard including a win at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) last time; that was a narrow success over Gladiadora but he's only 1lb higher here and should be in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: On much-reduced mark but he needs to raise his game back up in trip
runners.name: Epictetus
runners.spotlight: Group 3/Listed winner for the Gosdens as a 3yo, but a lot of water has flowed under the bridge since then; has dropped a long way in the weights but he was disappointing when favourite at Wolverhampton (8.6f) in November and needs to raise his game back up in trip; blinkers removed.

runners.comment: Overall record of 1-18 and he's struggled on the Flat and over hurdles in last two runs
runners.name: Midnight Rumble
runners.owner: Lets Get Ready To Rumble Partnership
runners.spotlight: Returned from a break with good second at Epsom (1m4f, good) in September but he's been tailed off and pulled up in two subsequent runs and latest was back over hurdles at Wincanton last month; has plenty to prove again and overall record is now 1-18.

runners.comment: Won at Newcastle (1m2f) before a good third behind an improver at Lingfield; respected
runners.name: Knockbrex
runners.spotlight: Back from a break with a narrow win at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) in November and he backed that up with a creditable third behind a major improver at Lingfield 11 days ago; still looks on a workable mark and has claims if this sets up for his closing style.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 5yo but well held in last three runs and needs a hood to make a difference
runners.name: Sheriffs Court
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-3 on turf when scoring at Carlisle (1m, soft) in July but he's been well held in three subsequent runs; still has low mileage but he was laboured at Wolverhampton (9.4f) last time and needs a hood to spark him back into action.

runners.comment: Well held in last two runs and his tactical speed will be tested back at this trip
runners.name: Melek Alreeh
runners.spotlight: Triple winner (1m4f) and last two have been on Tapeta at Southwell; had a couple of close calls on turf during the summer but he's been well held in last two runs; 1m6f may have stretched him last time but he has something to prove back at this trip after 101 days off.

runners.comment: Major improver who made it 2-2 over C&D when scoring in October; big player again up 4lb
runners.name: Time Tested
runners.spotlight: Major improver who made it five wins from his last ten starts when scoring in good style over C&D in October; 4lb higher on this step up in grade but he still looks feasibly treated and is unbeaten in two starts at this track; big player.

runners.comment: On dangerous mark but was down the field over C&D on recent stable debut; others preferred
runners.name: Alpine Oasis
runners.spotlight: Dual Tapeta winner for Karl Burke; only 1lb higher than for her last win (December 2024) but she's not easy to predict and was never involved over C&D (seventh of 12) on recent stable debut; others are more persuasive.

runners.comment: Has generally struggled in handicaps but his latest fourth at Newcastle was a fair effort
runners.name: Jodhpur Blue
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f Newcastle maiden last October; handicaps have been a major struggle but there have been a couple of exceptions including when fourth at Newcastle (1m2f) last month; that was behind an improver who made all and he could get involved if he can build on that.

16:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Possible excuse over C&D last weekend but the outside isn't ideal for this front-runner
runners.name: Early Release
runners.spotlight: Produced a career-best effort when making all at Kempton (6f) in September; not seen again until ninth over C&D on Saturday, weakening after pulling too hard; that should have knocked some of the freshness out of him but the draw hasn't been kind.

runners.comment: Below par on turf in autumn but this course winner is on good mark if reviving
runners.name: Cargin Bhui
runners.spotlight: Operating below his best on turf in the autumn but his mark has come down as a result and a solid record AW affords him plenty of respect back from a short break.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D in the autumn but overall AW record now 1-30
runners.name: Good Earth
runners.spotlight: Placed twice over C&D this autumn but below par over 5f here latest, taking his overall AW record to 1-30; others are more obvious for win purposes.

runners.comment: Arrives in form and enters calculations despite being drawn wider than ideal
runners.name: Bibendum
runners.spotlight: Hasn't always looked straightforward but he has been in good form for his new stable, winning at Redcar (6f) in August and then over 5f at Newcastle in November; creditable third of 13 back at Newcastle (5f again) since; the draw could have been kinder but he still enters calculations.

runners.comment: Placed twice over C&D in October but two lesser runs have followed and now 1-20 overall
runners.name: Sioux Warrior
runners.spotlight: Placed twice over C&D in October but two lesser runs have followed, taking his overall record to 1-20.

runners.comment: Struggled of late but won this off 6lb higher last year so revival isn't ruled out
runners.name: Royal Musketeer
runners.spotlight: Mixed record lately but the fact he won this race off 6lb higher 12 months ago means a revival can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Off 14 months but very well treated for excellent new yard; market confidence significant
runners.name: Betties Bay
runners.spotlight: Lost her way badly in the second half of 2024 but had quite some quite useful form prior to that and is dangerously well treated now starting out for the excellent James Owen yard after a 14-month layoff; changed hands for 9,000gns; market confidence would look very significant.

runners.comment: Exposed maiden who struggled to make an impact in handicaps last year
runners.name: Dark Sun
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden who struggled to make an impact in handicaps last year; needs an improved effort back from 104 days off.

runners.comment: Below par since 6f Newcastle win off this mark in September, including for new yard latest
runners.name: Fletchers Dream
runners.spotlight: Below par since 6f win at Newcastle off this mark in September, including for new yard last weekend.

runners.comment: Below par since 2yo maiden win; had wind op ahead of first run for 201 days
runners.name: Spirited Dancer
runners.spotlight: Won a Bath maiden for Jack Channon as a juvenile but failed to reproduce that form since, including in three runs for new yard in the first half of 2025; has had wind surgery ahead of this first run for 201 days; a watching brief is advised unless the betting hints at a revival.

runners.comment: Four course wins; fair fourth at Chelmsford latest and well treated if building on that
runners.name: Buraback
runners.spotlight: Better effort since returning from six months off when fourth of seven over 5f at Chelmsford 15 days ago; this four-time course scorer has handicapping scope if able to build on that having dropped to 2lb below the mark he defied at Chelmsford last April.

runners.comment: Inauspicious start for new yard when last at Southwell (7f) in November
runners.name: Initial Blue
runners.spotlight: AW winner for Richard Hannon but made an inauspicious start for new yard with a first-time tongue-tie added to regular cheekpieces when weakening quickly to be last of ten over 7f at Southwell in November; no headgear this time.

17:00.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: Proved resurgent in first-time visor at Newcastle most recently; could go well
runners.name: Desert Master
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner; proved resurgent in first-time visor at Newcastle (5f) most recently; could go well in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: Still a maiden and her form has regressed since going close at Chelmsford in August
runners.name: Dubai Magic
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and her form has steadily regressed since going close at Chelmsford in August; classified debut.

runners.comment: Last attempt at classified level resulted in a success; may stage a revival
runners.name: Global Effort
runners.spotlight: Off the boil since completing an August double but one of those wins was his last classified attempt; may revive back at this level.

runners.comment: Has failed to beat a rival in three novice events
runners.name: La Lunita
runners.spotlight: Has failed to beat a rival in three novice events, earning a mark of just 20; no form claims.

runners.comment: Ran respectably on last two outings, while shaping as if this return to 5f may suit
runners.name: Lion Ring
runners.spotlight: Losing run is mounting up but he ran respectably over 6f on last two outings, while shaping as if this return to 5f may suit; in the mix.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 5yo; gamely opened her account in Wolverhampton handicap last time; respected
runners.name: Midnight Call
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 5yo who gamely opened her account in 6f handicap at Wolverhampton most recently; may build on that win and show further progress at a modest level; should be as effective back over 5f; respected.

runners.comment: Record is only 1-22; holds very weak claims on her form for new stable
runners.name: She Went Whoosh
runners.spotlight: Record is only 1-22 and she holds very weak claims on her form for new stable; classified debut.

runners.comment: Still a maiden but ran well in C&D handicap most recently, bagging his first silver medal
runners.name: Sultan Of Oj
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but ran well in a C&D handicap most recently, bagging his first silver medal; gold one may be attainable kept to same scenario and dropped to this 0-50 classified level.

runners.comment: Maiden who posted a resurgent effort yesterday; possibilities dropped to 0-50
runners.name: Wee Mary
runners.spotlight: Maiden who posted a resurgent effort in Newcastle handicap (5f) yesterday on third start for new yard; possibilities dropped to 0-50 level.

17:30.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.breeder: Glebe Farm Stud & Peter & Ross Doyle
runners.comment: Combination of first-time headgear and switch to classified level may do the trick
runners.name: Back Before Dark
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and gained only win in 2023; however, this combination of first-time headgear and switch to classified level may do the trick.

runners.comment: Three C&D wins, the most recent last June; largely consistent since; solid claims
runners.name: Colors Of Freedom
runners.spotlight: Three C&D wins, the most recent last June; largely consistent since, close second here most recently; solid claims on classified debut.

runners.comment: Should benefit from the return to 5f and holds a fighting chance at the weights
runners.name: Forest Gunner
runners.spotlight: Outgunned over 6f last time; gained his autumn Southwell win over 5f; holds a fighting chance at the weights returned to this distance.

runners.comment: Gained sole win over 5f; major player at the weights returned to this distance
runners.name: Juno Star
runners.owner: The Ten Fools & A Horse Partnership
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Forest Gunner, having gained sole win over 5f at Southwell and finished fourth over 6f last time; major player at the weights.

runners.comment: Balance of recent form suggests a supporting role is on the cards
runners.name: Rogue De Vega
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D in 2024 but balance of recent form suggests a supporting role is on the cards back here.

runners.comment: Gained her only success in her sole classified event; may prove resurgent
runners.name: Sarabi
runners.spotlight: Gained her only success in her sole classified attempt; posted duck eggs the last twice but may prove resurgent back at this level.

runners.comment: Failed to score last year and finished last over C&D most recently
runners.name: Second Collection
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner down the years but failed to score in 2025 and finished last over C&D most recently; others preferred.

runners.comment: All wins on turf; regressive results since returned to AW
runners.name: Symbol Of Hope
runners.spotlight: All wins on turf, mostly at Bath; regressive results at Wolverhampton (6f) since returned to AW; not the percentage call.

runners.comment: Far from solid on the majority of his form since last March
runners.name: Tilsworth Ony Ta
runners.spotlight: Far from solid on the majority of his form since last March; losing run is mounting up.

18:00.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Gelded and absent since showing promise at Kempton in October 2024 for Ralph Beckett
runners.name: Ar Rayyan
runners.spotlight: Gelded and absent since showing promise (finished fourth) in 7f contest at Kempton in October 2024 for Ralph Beckett; helps to set the standard on that form but the market signals may offer the best guidance.

runners.comment: 8,000gns yearling; by Massaat; likely best watched on belated debut
runners.name: Je Suis Celebre
runners.spotlight: 8,000gns yearling; Massaat half-brother to three winners, notably Cape Coast (1m4f/1m6f; RPR 98); dam Italian Listed-placed 7.5f-1m3f scorer (101); likely best watched on belated debut.

runners.comment: Eyecatching third in latest Kempton start; frame possibilities if backing up that form
runners.name: Cincinnati Gold
runners.spotlight: Outsider in a couple of 7f events at Kempton but belied his odds with an eyecatching third, albeit comfortably held by first two, last time; frame possibilities, provided he backs up that effort.

runners.comment: 8,000euros foal; by Starman; other newcomers have stronger-looking claims
runners.name: Jn Starman
runners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd, Roger Thompson & Partner
runners.spotlight: 8,000euros foal; Starman half-brother to 6f 2yo winner Last Encore (RPR 95) out of unraced half-sister to 1m2f Group 2 scorer Manieree; other newcomers have stronger-looking claims.

runners.comment: Out of a winner for his connections; duly showed promise in Newmarket event; respected
runners.name: Stellar Vision
runners.spotlight: Out of a four-time winner, including 2-2 at Wolverhampton, for his connections; duly showed promise with rallying third to Godolphin colt in small-field contest at Newmarket (6f) nine weeks ago; likely to be suited by this extra furlong and commands respect.

runners.comment: 70,000gns yearling; by Mohaather; notable connections; one of the likelier types
runners.name: Tactical Blitz
runners.spotlight: 70,000gns yearling; Mohaather half-brother to winners Betty Clover (5f 2yo including Listed; RPR 99) and Another Thought (6f AW; 75); notable connections; one of the likelier types among the newcomers.

runners.comment: £5,000 yearling; by Zoustar; less interesting than a couple of the other newcomers
runners.name: Tommos Ginjaninja
runners.spotlight: £5,000 yearling; by Zoustar out of unraced half-sister to winners Herecomesthesun (useful 7f 2yo/1m) and Intimate Art (7f/1m); far less interesting than a couple of the other newcomers.

runners.comment: Frankel filly who is related to winners for her connections; interesting debutante
runners.name: Star Obsession
runners.spotlight: Frankel filly who is a sister to two winners, notably Frankellina (Group-placed 1m 2yo; RPR 105), and out of a 1m-1m4f scorer (including Listed; 108), a family that her connections know well; interesting debutante.

18:30.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: Finished behind reopposing rivals over C&D on last two starts; still likely to be involved
runners.name: Straight A
runners.spotlight: 1lb better off with Landlordtothestars for a head defeat here in November; also finished behind Arnaz when sixth over C&D last month; should give his running and more minor money on the cards.

runners.comment: Won cosily over C&D five weeks ago but a 6lb rise asks a stiffer question
runners.name: Chifa
runners.spotlight: Into the veteran stage but he retains plenty of enthusiasm and he was a ready winner over C&D five weeks ago (good Topspeed figure); a 6lb rise asks more of him but should give his running.

runners.comment: Frustrating sort but his stable debut was encouraging and he is well capable off this mark
runners.name: Arnaz
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut in May 2024 (7f, good) but beaten 14 times since; that said, his stable debut here last month wasn't without promise and he has the ability to go well off a reduced mark; leading contender.

runners.comment: Has shown promise in three 7f AW runs; more needed to defy this mark now handicapping
runners.name: Al Hofzan
runners.spotlight: Promise in three AW runs but the last two have come in especially weak affairs; improvement will be required to defy this opening mark.

runners.comment: Returned from a break to beat Straight A over C&D five weeks ago; respected up just 1lb
runners.name: Landlordtothestars
runners.spotlight: Returned from six months off to win a C&D handicap five weeks ago, beating the reopposing Straight A by a head on 1lb better terms; should give it another good go.

runners.comment: C&D winner; not fired in two runs for new yard after a break
runners.name: Adelaide Bay
runners.spotlight: Won three 7f AW handicaps for Jane Chapple-Hyam in the first half of 2025 (including C&D); two low-key runs for new yard after a break though.

runners.comment: C&D winner; not at best since his 8.6f win here in October; needs a strong pace to chase
runners.name: River Wharfe
runners.spotlight: Came from off the pace to win an 8.6f Class 6 handicap here in October; unplaced in three runs since and he will need them to go hard early if he is to win back at 7f.

19:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: On a losing run; arrives in fair form but likely something will prove stronger
runners.name: Al Rufaa
runners.spotlight: Conditions to suit but he is on a long losing run and usually manages to find something stronger; arrives in form and holds each-way claims once more.

runners.comment: Two AW wins last year; not at best last time but no surprise were he to bounce back
runners.name: Threatening
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins last year, the latest over 1m at Chelmsford in November; beaten off this mark at Kempton two weeks later but still likely to give a good account.

runners.comment: C&D winner; finished behind Tonal when 4th at Kempton last time; another 1lb higher now
runners.name: Studious
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; twice successful last year, comfortably seeing off seven rivals at Newcastle in November on the second occasion; finished behind Tonal when fourth at Kempton under a penalty and he is another 1lb higher today.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and arrives in good order; needs more to defy this mark though
runners.name: Ernies Valentine
runners.spotlight: Multiple AW winner, including two over C&D; two solid in-frame efforts last month and should run well but he will need to pull out more to defy this mark.

runners.comment: Ran okay in a stronger C&D handicap last week; each-way claims back down to Class 5
runners.name: Boubyan
runners.spotlight: Close third over C&D in November before a heavy defeat at Newcastle; last week's midfield finish here (met some trouble) came in a higher grade and he has each-way claims.

runners.comment: C&D winner and on his last winning mark; needs to step up on last month's Southwell 7th
runners.name: Soames Forsyte
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; beat seven rivals to win a Nottingham handicap off this mark last July; may come on for recent return from an eight-week break but others look more persuasive.

runners.comment: Won 3 of last 4 and had excuse for the defeat; up another 6lb but foolish to underestimate
runners.name: Tonal
runners.spotlight: Hamstrung by a wide trip when second at Kempton on December 1 but that is his only defeat in four AW runs since October; looked to have a fair bit up his sleeve when winning at Chelmsford three weeks ago and he is a strong candidate despite a 6lb rise.

runners.comment: 7f win here last month and went close at Newcastle one week later; form dipped last time
runners.name: Lessay
runners.spotlight: Finished strongly to win a 7f handicap here last month and he followed it with a good second at Newcastle (7f); not so good over 1m back at Newcastle 13 days ago; minor money perhaps his best hope.

19:30.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap

runners.comment: C&D win in November; second next time but only fifth last twice
runners.name: Beaumadier
runners.spotlight: Everything went like clockwork when winning easily over C&D in November; good second off this mark next time but not in quite the same form when fifth at Southwell and over C&D since.

runners.comment: Well treated on last winter's AW form but not obviously at the top of his game
runners.name: Bang On The Bell
runners.spotlight: Ran okay from out of the handicap back from a break over C&D in November but failed to build on that when only seventh at Southwell since; starting to look well treated on last winter's AW form but need to see more.

runners.comment: Added to solid AW record with C&D win last month; should remain competitive off 4lb higher
runners.name: Blue Force
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.spotlight: All four wins over 5f on Tapeta, the latest here 25 days ago; he had subsequent winners in behind him on that occasion, including Gustav Graves, and should remain competitive off 4lb higher.

runners.comment: 5f turf win in July for Mick Appleby but largely struggled for this yard since
runners.name: Honour Your Dreams
runners.spotlight: Ended his time with Mick Appleby with a 5f turf win at Lingfield in July but has largely struggled for this yard since, including back on AW a fortnight ago; has a hood refitted.

runners.comment: No win since debut but placed on three of last four run; drawn wide but still respected
runners.name: Emperors Son
runners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd
runners.spotlight: Still to add to his debut success but he's been placed on three of last four starts (AW last twice) and should be on the premises again assuming the outside stall isn't too big an inconvenience; visor goes back on.

runners.comment: 1-15 but he has been runner-up last twice, including C&D; considered
runners.name: Speed Of Maajid
runners.spotlight: Just one win to his name but he is threatening to put that right, finishing second over C&D and at Southwell (5f) on his last two outings, despite slowish starts on both occasions; this might be his day.

runners.comment: Landed another C&D win in late November but has yet to win back to back in her long career
runners.name: Basholo
runners.spotlight: Bit all or nothing but she did win over C&D under Zak Wheatley in October/November, pipping Gustav Graves latterly; yet to win back to back in her 53-race career.

runners.comment: Carries 4lb penalty for last week's C&D win, his eighth at the track; respected
runners.name: Gustav Graves
runners.spotlight: Eighth course win when seeing off six rivals over this trip 11 days ago; has a 4lb penalty to carry in a higher grade now but he's dangerous to rule out in his current mood.

20:00.race_name: Join The Midnite Movement Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Promise over 6f/1m first two starts and 1m4f presumably too far latest; handicap debut
runners.name: Zed Candy Boy
runners.spotlight: Displayed promise in two Southwell novice races over 6f/1m in November; presumably had his stamina stretched when weakening quickly over 1m4f here since and retains potential for handicaps back at shorter.

runners.comment: Now 4lb lower than for C&D win last March but needs to leave recent efforts behind
runners.name: Prince Ali
runners.spotlight: All six wins have been on Tapeta, the latest over C&D over last March; now 4lb lower than for that win but he needs to leave recent efforts well behind.

runners.comment: Good start to handicap career when third (Naughty Niall second) over C&D; respected
runners.name: Hawaiian King
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who made sound start to his handicap career when third (Naughty Niall nose ahead in second) over C&D three weeks ago; could build on that and Jack Nicholls takes an additional 5lb off this time; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Held off a subsequent winner over C&D latest and a 3lb rise may not stop him
runners.name: Moonlight Bomb
runners.spotlight: 13th time lucky when just holding on from Mr Nugget (won since) over C&D under Cieren Fallon 13 days ago; a 3lb rise looks manageable.

runners.comment: Now 7lb lower than when winning here last summer but recent efforts poor
runners.name: Sense Of Worth
runners.spotlight: Now 7lb lower than when landing AW win number five over the extended 1m here last summer but his recent efforts have been very disappointing; needs a major revival.

runners.comment: Not the force of old but recent in-frame efforts show he can still be competitive
runners.name: Revich
runners.spotlight: Formerly useful; 0-9 for this yard but recent in-frame efforts on AW (C&D latest) show this now 10yo can still be competitive from his reduced mark.

runners.comment: Third on 1m h'cap/yard debut; only fifth since but still early days; hood on up in trip
runners.name: Rogue Identity
runners.spotlight: Made a solid start to his handicap career for new trainer James Owen when third over 1m at Chelmsford in November; his subsequent 7f Southwell fifth was no more than respectable but he remains one who could click for this prolific stable; a first-time hood goes on now stepping up in trip.

runners.comment: May have needed recent yard debut after 199 days off and now 1lb below her winning mark
runners.name: Take The Boat
runners.spotlight: With Des Donovan when winning by a short head over 7f at Kempton last spring; less productive since but was entitled to need her recent yard debut after 199 days off and she's 1lb below the mark she defied at Kempton.

runners.comment: 1m4f course win in November and creditable second over C&D latest; in the mix again
runners.name: Naughty Niall
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year, the latter over 1m4f here in November; with a tongue-tie and cheekpieces combined for the first time he produced another good effort at this course when second over this trip three weeks ago, with reopposing Hawaiian King just behind in third; ought to be in the mix again.

runners.comment: Has started well for Tony Carroll, including close second over C&D on Boxing Day; player
runners.name: Scenario
runners.spotlight: Her sole win came over 7f on turf in July but she looked suited by the step up in trip when narrowly denied over C&D on Boxing Day; player off the same mark.

20:30.race_name: Join The Midnite Movement Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Well treated but losing run up to 11 and quiet in three runs after a break
runners.name: Ciotog
runners.spotlight: Won here off 7lb higher just under a year ago but 0-11 since then and has been quiet in three runs after a break.

runners.comment: Lightly raced; only 2l away in 1m2f AW handicap at Lingfield before a 5l defeat over 1m3f
runners.name: Time Turner
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced; only 2l away in a 1m2f AW handicap at Lingfield before a 5l defeat over 1m3f at Southwell (first-time cheekpieces); didn't appear to stay that day and could run well back at this trip.

runners.comment: Hard to win with but was close up over C&D 13 days ago despite late interference
runners.name: Seraphic
runners.spotlight: Hard to win with but was close up over C&D 13 days ago despite meeting with late interference; in the mix.

runners.comment: Off reduced mark when dead-heating over C&D last week; essentially 1lb lower
runners.name: Law Supreme
runners.spotlight: Exploited his reduced mark when dead-heating over C&D last week and essentially 1lb lower here with Ryan Kavanagh's claim more than erasing his penalty; does have a wider draw to contend with.

runners.comment: Tailed off the last twice over hurdles and reservations returned to Flat action
runners.name: Offiahs Boy
runners.spotlight: Running well when falling over hurdles in October but that may have knocked his confidence having been tailed off in his two subsequent races; reservations on this return to Flat action.

runners.comment: Got behind before staying on when behind Seraphic here last time; might go well
runners.name: Magic Runner
runners.spotlight: Only 1-17; has threatened to win more and got behind before staying on when behind Seraphic here last time; C&D winner who should run well if getting the breaks (usually held up).

runners.comment: Won over 1m at Southwell and ran fairly well dropped to 7f when penalised at Lingfield
runners.name: Latin
runners.spotlight: Won over 1m at Southwell and ran fairly well dropped to 7f when penalised at Lingfield; 2lb lower this time and over a better trip.

runners.comment: Worrying that he's 0-14 on the AW and lost lengths at the start here 13 days ago
runners.name: Pride Of Nepal
runners.spotlight: Has dropped to a favourable mark; however, worrying that he's 0-14 on the AW and lost lengths at the start here 13 days ago.

runners.comment: 0-9 in Ireland but made some late headway over 8.6f here on recent stable debut
runners.name: Eutropia
runners.spotlight: 0-9 in Ireland but made some late headway over 8.6f here on recent stable debut and won't mind returning to further.

runners.comment: Only her fifth start and first for this yard when never-dangerous fifth over C&D last week
runners.name: Petra Grey
runners.spotlight: Only her fifth start and first for this yard when a never-dangerous fifth over C&D last week; entitled to build on that.

runners.comment: Just got the better of Sean here last term and smart form in defeat in Britain since
runners.name: Arabian Light
