runners.spotlight: Just got the better of Sean in a 1m1f handicap here last season and even better form in defeat in Britain in the summer including a third to Fox Legacy at Newmarket; workable mark, potentially more to come and he's the first-string for a yard in-form.

runners.comment: Only narrowly denied in hat-trick bid when last seen and that form has worked out
runners.name: Bedouin Prince
runners.spotlight: Maiden win at Doncaster came over this trip before an impressive novice success on the Rowley Mile at Newmarket (1m, good) and was only narrowly touched off in his hat-trick bid on the July course when last seen; that form has worked out nicely and he's a fascinating runner stepping back up in trip on return; gelded since last seen 174 days ago.

runners.comment: Won both starts at 3 inc' valuable Newmarket h'cap latest; while up 13lb, he's respected
runners.name: Kings Charter
runners.spotlight: Promise as a juvenile and won both starts as a three-year-old, following up a novice success at Doncaster to win a valuable handicap at Newmarket over this trip; 13lb higher now but that's an effort worth marking up having raced away from the favoured rail and one for the shortlist.

runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux, J Etienne
runners.comment: Lost unbeaten record in the Dante when too bad to be true but won his first 3 inc' Listed
runners.name: Alpine Trail
runners.spotlight: Won each of his first three starts including a Listed success over this trip at Newmarket before losing his unbeaten record when too bad to be true in the Dante; not seen since and has been gelded; probably has a stiff enough mark on the back of a 232-day absence.

runners.comment: Signed off last season with Listed win at Abu Dhabi; not as good this term and tough mark
runners.name: Stormy Ocean
runners.spotlight: Signed off last season's campaign with a Listed success at Abu Dhabi; struggled both outings this term and while a Group 2 here a fortnight ago was too warm for him, he seems on a stiff-enough mark.

runners.comment: Career best came over 1m2f but little in 3 runs since and left Ballydoyle for 40,000gns
runners.name: Rock Of Cashel
runners.spotlight: Career best came in four-runner contest over this trip at Navan but lost his way a little in three subsequent runs; left Aidan O'Brien for 40,000gns and others are probably on better marks.

runners.comment: Won York h'cap before a big run in John Smith's Cup and only up 2lb for the latter
runners.name: Archivist
runners.spotlight: Improved for William Haggas last season, following up a Leicester maiden win to land a 12-runner handicap at York and ran a cracker in his hat-trick bid in the John Smith's Cup when beaten roughly 2l by Fox Legacy; 2lb rise is justified and he should be thereabouts if fit after 174 days off.

runners.comment: Big step forward to win on dirt return; not as good latest; needs career best and stall 14
runners.name: Shepperton Lodge
runners.spotlight: Took a big step forward to win on dirt return here and possibly still feeling the effects of that run when a 10l fourth (sent off 13-8 favourite); this demands a career best back on turf and stall 14 isn't any help.

runners.comment: Smart form in France and was 4-9 for Andre Fabre; gelded ahead of yard debut; needs more
runners.name: Will Scarlet
runners.spotlight: Smart form in France and won four of his nine starts for Andre Fabre; gelded ahead of yard debut and would need to take a step forward to defy this mark.

runners.comment: Went back-to-back in h'caps last year; signs h'capper caught up; bought for 75,000gns
runners.name: Dantes Lad
runners.spotlight: Went back-to-back in handicaps in Britain in the summer but signs the handicapper had caught up towards the end of the campaign; new yard having been purchased for 75,000gns and career best called for.

runners.comment: Best form in France came on heavy; tailed off on dirt when making UAE debut; stiff mark
runners.name: Jenilat Bright
runners.spotlight: Best form in France came on heavy and possibly didn't handle dirt when tailed off on UAE debut three weeks ago; return to this surface will help but seems on a stiff mark for what he's achieved.

runners.comment: Won Gowran Classic; hasn't matched that in 3 runs for new yard; only beaten 3l here latest
runners.name: Green Triangle
runners.spotlight: Won twice for Joseph O'Brien including the valuable Gowran Classic; hasn't matched that form in three runs for these connections but step back in the right direction when beaten 3l here three weeks ago, despite a poor trip; at his best with a strong gallop to aim at.

runners.comment: Went close here last season behind Arabian Light; lost his way since and opposable
runners.name: Sean
runners.spotlight: Went close here last season behind Arabian Light; poor campaign in Britain and was beaten roughly 8l on his return here (1m1f) here three weeks ago; no wins since 2023 and he's opposable, despite his sliding mark.

runners.comment: C&D winner; Jebel Ali Group 3 winner last term; struggled on dirt this term; best watched
runners.name: Qareeb
runners.spotlight: Won a Jebel Ali Group 3 last term and his best turf effort came in a C&D success two seasons ago; hasn't been at his best in two dirt starts this year and while he has a lower turf mark to work with, others look more likely.

runners.comment: Ran a cracker on dirt debut when narrowly denied but 5lb higher with widest draw now
runners.name: Don Pacifico
runners.spotlight: Just a novice win to his name but ran a cracker on his dirt debut here last month when a shade unlucky not to get past re-opposing Welcome Dream; up 5lb in a tougher race with the widest draw to overcome and he's opposable this time.

runners.comment: 3 wins on dirt at Jebel Ali but low-key return and others look more likely
runners.name: Lahfaty
runners.spotlight: Three wins on dirt, all at Jebel Ali including a win over this trip in March; however, slowly away and never involved on her return to action at that venue last month; needs to leave that behind.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner, the latest when making all from Don Pacifico last month; up 6lb
runners.name: Welcome Dream
runners.owner: Sheikh Abdul Aziz Bin Humaid Al Nuaimi
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner, the latest when making all last month, just holding on from Don Pacifico; up 6lb but he's a potential pace angle and has a better draw this time.

runners.comment: No wins since debut and below form on yard debut latest; not sure to appreciate dirt
runners.name: Columnist
runners.spotlight: No wins since his debut at Chester and was below form on yard debut here three weeks ago on turf; not sure to appreciate the switch to dirt.

runners.breeder: Shawhan Place Llc, Dr Perry Wornall & William A Thomson
runners.comment: Jebel Ali winner on debut but hasn't managed to build on that and stiff mark; off 306 days
runners.name: Nahaash
runners.spotlight: All four runs at Jebel Ali, winning on debut (5f) but has not managed to build on that and he has a stiff-looking mark; off 306 days.

runners.comment: Progressed in Britain last summer but didn't show enough on dirt debut 3 weeks ago
runners.name: Dapper Valley
runners.spotlight: Progressed for James Owen in Britain towards the end of last season but didn't show enough on his dirt debut over C&D three weeks ago.

runners.comment: 7f course winner; step back in right direction behind 2 of these latest but tough ask
runners.name: Sir Harmony
runners.spotlight: 7f course winner and it was a step back in the right direction behind Welcome Dream and Don Pacifico here last month; better off at the weights but hard to see him reversing that form.

runners.comment: Back-to-back winner here last term but possibly in the handicapper's grip for now
runners.name: Smart System
runners.spotlight: Followed up a 7f course success with a C&D win last term; hasn't managed to build on that in three runs since and potentially in the handicapper's grip.

runners.comment: UAE Oaks 2nd; hasn't shown anything in 2 starts this term; tough draw for front-runner
runners.name: Arigatou Gozaimasu
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who was only narrowly denied in the UAE Oaks last term but she hasn't shown anything in two starts this time around and tough draw for her preferred tactics here.

runners.comment: Respectable third on turf here last season but sole dirt run was a low-key effort
runners.name: Force And Valour
runners.spotlight: Respectable third on turf here last season but sole dirt run was a low-key effort and he wasn't at his best in Britain last year.

runners.breeder: Jd Stuart, Ar Enterprises, Inc & Godolphin
runners.comment: Came on from his return to win over C&D but disappointing twice since; only dropped 1lb
runners.name: Road Bloc
runners.spotlight: Came on from his return to win over C&D but he's been disappointing twice since and only dropped 1lb; looks up against it again.

runners.comment: Jebel Ali winner over this trip last term but below his best in two runs this season
runners.name: Guarani
runners.spotlight: Jebel Ali winner over this trip last term but below his best in two runs this season and O'Shea prefers Welcome Dream.

runners.comment: Maiden; 2nd on 3 of last 4 starts inc' C&D latest but this is more demanding
runners.name: Royalcorrespondent
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden but runner-up twice at Jebel Ali this term and bounced back from a lesser run when beaten half a legnth over C&D three weeks ago; this is more demanding and he's up in the weights.

runners.comment: No wins since Listed success in Britain in 2023 and better dirt runs have come over 7f+
runners.name: Action Point
runners.spotlight: No wins since a Listed success in Britain in July 2023; his better dirt runs have come over further than this and was well held on turf last time out; questions to answer from this mark but looks like the yard's first-string at least.

runners.comment: Well held on yard debut over 1m and best watched dropped in trip; reserve
runners.name: No Escape
runners.spotlight: First reserve; well held on yard debut over 1m and best watched dropped in trip.

runners.breeder: Three Lyons Racing, Llc & Ssh Enterprises
runners.comment: 5f winner at Jebel Ali on his penultimate start but this mark may be tough
runners.name: Saarim
runners.owner: Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khalifa Al Maktoum
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 5f winner at Jebel Ali on his penultimate start but this mark may be tough.

runners.comment: Dirt winner at Jebel Ali and respectable run on return from lengthy absence; reserve
runners.name: Houb Al Wattan
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; dirt winner at Jebel Ali and respectable run on return from lengthy absence back there 62 days ago.

runners.comment: Hasn't been at best on last two starts and will have to fare better if he's to win this
runners.name: Megarry
runners.spotlight: Has won three of 23 starts but well beaten on last two outings at Chantilly (Group 3) and at Abu Dhabi (Listed); may be suited by more give in the ground and best watched.

runners.comment: Developed into a smart sprinter in 2025; interesting down in trip under Billy Loughnane
runners.name: Two Tribes
runners.spotlight: Made up into a smart sprinter last year, with wins in the Stewards' Cup and over 7f at Ascot; solid runs in defeat on last three starts and interesting under Billy Loughnane for UAE debut.

runners.comment: Not won since landing the 2024 Papin; has been gelded but may be suited by more give
runners.name: Arabie
runners.spotlight: Dual Group-winning juvenile but, although he hasn't added to tally since, he shaped as though retaining all his ability last year; gelded since last run but still to show he's as good on fast ground as he is with a bit of cut.

runners.comment: Well beaten on yard debut following an absence last time; best watched
runners.name: Bold Style
runners.owner: Sheikh Abdul Aziz Bin Humaid Al Nuaimi
runners.spotlight: Listed-placed for Charlie Appleby in 2024; soundly beaten on first run for trainer following a near 11-month lay off in December; best watched on that evidence.

runners.comment: Best effort to win the Ayr Gold Cup in September; could give a good account on UAE debut
runners.name: Run Boy Run
runners.spotlight: Handles most ground and turned in an improved effort when winning the Ayr Gold Cup on soft in September; bit below that level in Group 3 the following month but a player back in handicap on UAE debut.

runners.comment: Has won four of six starts, including over C&D on turf debut last time; leading claims
runners.name: Yotarid
runners.spotlight: Progressive triple dirt winner who turned in best effort to score over C&D on turf debut; up 5lb and up in grade but surprise if he's not capable of better after only six outings.

runners.comment: All wins on AW/dirt but just as good on turf and should appreciate the return to 6f
runners.name: Rabaah
runners.spotlight: Yet to win on turf but pick of form on grass matched that he's achieved on AW/dirt; respectable effort over 5f at this venue last time and not without a chance in open event back up in trip.

runners.comment: Solid effort on handicap debut and this lightly raced sort could improve further
runners.name: Indian Springs
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced sort who has won two of four starts and posted a solid effort on handicap debut over 7f at Newmarket in September; drops back in trip but he's the type to progress further.

runners.comment: Multiple winner over 7f-1m; return to turf should suit but still to prove this trip does
runners.name: Chaldero
runners.spotlight: Has won five of 23 starts, most recently at Longchamp in September; return to turf should suit (well beaten on dirt on UAE debut) but still to show this trip suits as well as further.

runners.comment: Dual winner at this venue in 2024 but not had much racing since and well beaten last time
runners.name: Vespasian
runners.spotlight: Hasn't had much racing since winning twice over both turf sprint distances at this venue in 2024; well beaten over C&D last time and others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Claims on Stewards' Cup fifth placing but below form since and on a long losing run
runners.name: Twilight Calls
runners.spotlight: Ran well when fifth in the Stewards' Cup (best of those to race far side) but below that level since and hasn't won since spring 2022; handicapped to run well but percentage call is to watch.

runners.comment: Shaped as though retaining much of ability over C&D last time; another to consider
runners.name: Haasim
runners.spotlight: Turf and dirt winner in UAE and shaped as though retaining ability when third to Yotarid over C&D last month; another to consider in open event.

runners.comment: C&D winner a year ago; below best at end of last season and well beaten on reappearance
runners.name: Rasas
runners.spotlight: C&D winner a year ago but below best on last two outings of last season and well beaten over C&D on return; tongue-tie fitted but plenty more needed.

runners.comment: Touched off by Yotarid on UAE debut last time; up in weights/grade but can't rule out
runners.name: Righthere Rightnow
runners.spotlight: Debut winner who had slipped in the weights and ran well when touched off by Yotarid over C&D on UAE debut last time; up in the weights and back up in grade but likely to do better.

15:15.race_name: Jumeirah Stakes Sponsored By The Jockey Club (Conditions) (Turf)

runners.comment: 7f conditions winner on turf in Sweden; more needed if he's to win on this UAE debut
runners.name: Bruce Almighty
runners.spotlight: Won 7f conditions event from three starts in Scandinavia but he'll have to step up on those efforts if he's to make a winning UAE debut.

runners.comment: Not far off best when fourth in Newmarket Group 3 last time; likely to run well
runners.name: Catullus
runners.spotlight: Useful sort; wasn't far off best when fourth in Group 3 at Newmarket on final start; drawn wide for this UAE debut but likely to give a good account for trainer who won this last year.

runners.comment: Useful debut winner but hasn't matched that form since; needs to improve to take this
runners.name: Northern Champion
runners.spotlight: Debut winner at Deauville but hasn't matched that form in two starts (behind Catullus at Newmarket); well beaten in testing ground on Arc weekend when last seen and needs to improve for the return to a sound surface.

runners.comment: Improved effort to win over C&D on UAE/yard debut last time; claims, despite wide draw
runners.name: Power For Power
runners.spotlight: Stepped up a fair way on the form shown for Roger Varian when beating Do Or Do Not (pair clear) over C&D on UAE/stable debut last time; drawn much wider this time but he's a scopey sort who seems sure to do better; big chance.

runners.comment: Similar level of useful form on both starts and is another to consider, despite wide draw
runners.name: Title Role
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.spotlight: Short-headed over 6f at Newbury on debut but made amends over this trip on AW last time; capable of better but is another who hasn't been done many favours by the draw.

runners.comment: Debut winner who disappointed in the Chesham; off since but well drawn and has claims
runners.name: Treanmor
runners.spotlight: Justified cramped odds at Newmarket on debut so it was disappointing that he wasn't able to match that effort in the Chesham at Royal Ascot; off since but unlikely to fail on the score of fitness and much better drawn than the majority of his main rivals; player.

runners.comment: Clear form choice on pick of efforts; below best on last three starts but should run well
runners.name: Do Or Do Not
runners.owner: Seymour Bloodstock, Northwood Equine Et Al
runners.spotlight: Form choice on the pick of his efforts in Group company (placed in the Coventry/July/Vintage) but hasn't matched that in last three starts and turned over by Power For Power over C&D on UAE/stable debut last time; isn't the biggest and may again find one or two too strong.

runners.comment: Promise at an ordinary level on debut but plenty to prove on unfavourable terms
runners.name: Hoyam Laih
runners.spotlight: Just behind a subsequent winner at Southwell on debut in October; looked open to improvement but has since left the Crisfords and work to do on turf/stable/UAE debut.

runners.comment: Respectable debut effort on dirt on his rules debut but good deal more required this time
runners.name: Ishtiah
runners.spotlight: Trial winner and respectable fourth on dirt behind the exciting Lino Padrino (runs later on the card) over this trip on his rules debut but has plenty to find switched to turf.

runners.comment: Limitations exposed both outings on dirt and makes no appeal switched to turf
runners.name: Kaido
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown enough in two dirt starts to suggest he'll be figuring on these terms switched to turf.

runners.comment: Better than bare form suggests over C&D on UAE debut but more needed to win this
runners.name: Start Me Up
runners.spotlight: Deserves credit given his jockey lost an iron and nearly unseated in the straight on UAE debut and, although he doesn't appeal as a likely winner, he should get closer to Power For Power and Do Or Do Not.

runners.comment: Last of six in a trial in November; hard to see him winning a trial on his debut
runners.name: Waggad
runners.spotlight: Last of six in a trial in November and hard to see this one making a winning rules debut now switching to grass.

runners.breeder: 1 0E A R L Haras De Montaigu & 1 0Autre Hunscote Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Fair form when placed behind Power For Power over C&D on his debut; more needed again
runners.name: Zumbezi
runners.spotlight: Placed at Prague on debut and ran well behind Power For Power and Do Or Do Not over C&D on UAE debut; should improve for that, but hard to see him reverse placings with those rivals.

runners.comment: Progressive sort who won at Kempton last time; capable of better on this UAE debut
runners.name: Callahan
runners.spotlight: Has improved with every start and best effort when beating a subsequent winner (fourth has also since won) at Kempton in October; capable of better and has minor place claims on this UAE debut.

runners.comment: Won dirt trial at Jebel Ali but plenty to prove on this rules/turf debut
runners.name: Hannem
runners.spotlight: US-bred who won trial in convincing fashion at Jebel Ali last month; plenty to prove in this company on rules/turf debut.

15:50.race_name: Dubawi Stakes Sponsored By France Galop (Group 3) (Dirt)

runners.comment: Golden Shaheen winner who had excuses last term and well worth giving another chance to
runners.name: Dark Saffron
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive last term, signing off the campaign with a surprise success in the Golden Shaheen and made easy work of his return over C&D; nothing went right when tailed off at Listed level since (banged head on the gate and involved in pace dual before fading tamely) and well worth giving another chance to, despite having to concede weight to all.

runners.comment: Beat White Abarrio at Gulfstream Park in December 2024 but not near that level
runners.name: Mufasa
runners.spotlight: Beat White Abarrio at Gulfstream Park in December 2024; not near that level in two runs since and probably needs a bit further.

runners.comment: Had 3 of these in behind over C&D last month but not sure to confirm form here
runners.name: El Nasseeb
runners.owner: Mohd Abdulla Mohd Rashed Al Shehhi
runners.spotlight: Had Dark Saffron, Colour up and Mufasa in behind when winning in Listed company over C&D last month but that race couldn't have worked out any better for him; likely to need them to go too hard in front.

runners.comment: Big step forward from last season to win C&D h'cap on return but not sure to be up to this
runners.name: Drews Gold
runners.spotlight: Took a big step forward from last season's efforts to win a C&D handicap on his return three weeks ago but not sure to be up to this class and it's telling that O'Shea rides stablemate Mufasa.

runners.comment: Creditable run behind El Nasseeb on return but he's exposed and this demands a career best
runners.name: Colour Up
runners.spotlight: Regularly chased home Tuz last season and creditable effort on return behind El Nasseeb but he's exposed and this demands a career best.

runners.comment: Smart handicapper/Listed performer in Britain but this is a very tough dirt introduction
runners.name: Apollo One
runners.spotlight: Smart handicapper/Listed performer in Britain but he would need to be better on dirt to have a say against these and there are significant doubts about that.

runners.comment: 2nd on dirt at Jebel Ali last term but best form is over 5f on turf and this is turf
runners.name: Ponntos
runners.spotlight: Regular front-runner who finished runner-up in a Listed event on dirt at Jebel Ali last season; however, his best form is on turf over 5f and he would need to be right at his best to take this out; below form on return to UAE two weeks ago in 5f Listed race on the turf.

16:25.race_name: Zabeel Mile Sponsored By Phi Advertising (Group 2) (Turf)

runners.comment: Listed/Gr 3 winner in France last year and narrowly denied in Gr 2; poor Ascot run latest
runners.name: Quddwah
runners.spotlight: Won twice in France last year, a Longchamp Listed contest and a Chantilly Group 3, both on soft; only narrowly denied in a Group 2 at Longchamp in October but struggled at Ascot subsequently; suspicion he's at his best on ground a bit softer than what he gets here but has solid claims on ratings.

runners.comment: Narrowly denied in this last term and returned from break with two big runs in Britain
runners.name: Holloway Boy
runners.owner: N White, S White, T White & E Burke
runners.spotlight: Narrowly denied in this last term before a 5l third in the Jebel Hatta and posted another big effort in the Singspiel Stakes; too bad to be true in the Dubai Turf subsequently; missed most of the season in Britain but as good as ever when narrowly denied in the Balmoral and backed that up with Kempton Listed win; stall 10 isn't ideal but rock solid bar that factor.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Saint Pair & S A S Ec
runners.comment: Good 3rd in Craven but poor run in French Guineas when last seen; gelded; needs more
runners.name: Aomori City
runners.spotlight: Beaten roughly 1l in 2024 Juvenile Turf at Breeders' Cup and ran well after slow start in the Craven; poor run in the French Guineas when last seen and gelded since; needs sizeable career best returning from 236 days off.

runners.comment: 1m6f Group 3 winner here last term but fair bit to find on ratings; trip surely too sharp
runners.name: Keffaaf
runners.spotlight: 1m6f Group 3 winner here last season but has a fair bit to find on ratings and this is surely too sharp for him at this stage.

runners.comment: Lockinge/Lennox winner in 2024; not at best last term; bought for 170,000gns and new yard
runners.name: Audience
runners.spotlight: Lockinge winner in his pomp and he's dangerous when allowed to dictate; however, hasn't won since his Lennox success in 2024 and he wasn't at his best at this sort of level in Britain last term; switch to a new yard needs to spark a revival after 170,000gns purchase.

runners.comment: Beaten 1l in Gr 3 at Leopardstown in August; not as good twice since and this looks tough
runners.name: Chicago Critic
runners.spotlight: Listed winner in Ireland last year and only beaten 1l in a Group 3 at Leopardstown in August; not as good twice since and this looks tough.

runners.comment: Dirt h'cap winner last term but doesn't have the form to be a factor in this
runners.name: Asad Zabeel
runners.spotlight: Won handicap on dirt here last season and respectable dirt return in a handicap but doesn't have the form to be a factor at this level on turf.

runners.comment: Eyecatching return in Listed class and return to 1m may suit but this demands career best
runners.name: Vafortino
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, Anoj Don & Dahab Racing
runners.spotlight: Ran an eyecatching race in a Listed contest here a fortnight ago, shaping like a return to this trip could suit; however, this demands a career best and that looks unlikely at the age of eight.

runners.comment: Regularly involved at Listed level and eyecatcher here latest; 1m may suit but tough task
runners.name: Andreas Vesalius
runners.spotlight: Regularly involved at Listed level and was a big eyecatcher in Listed company here a fortnight ago; first run at a mile and shapes like it will suit but looks out of his depth at this level.

runners.comment: As good as ever when beaten 3l in Abu Dhabi Listed race last month but that's his level
runners.name: Western Writer
runners.spotlight: As good as ever when beaten roughly 3l in Abu Dhabi Listed race last month but that's his level.

17:00.race_name: UAE 2000 Guineas Trial Sponsored By Churchill Downs (Conditions) (Dirt)

runners.comment: Has won both starts in Argentina and interesting runner on UAE/stable debut, despite draw
runners.name: Legalaized
runners.owner: Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khalifa Al Maktoum
runners.spotlight: Has won both starts in Argentina, a dirt maiden on debut and a Listed event on turf when last seen in June; interesting on UAE/stable debut, though wide draw an obvious concern.

runners.comment: Debut dirt winner in Uruguay; second in Listed over 1m1f next time; interesting in UAE
runners.name: Namaguederaz
runners.spotlight: Debut dirt winner in Uruguay in August (7.5f) and second in Listed event over 1m1f next time; back in trip and worth keeping an eye on for UAE/stable debut.

runners.comment: Won by a clear margin in Sweden on debut (dirt) and another to note on first UAE start
runners.name: Bullet Bling
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin dirt winner in Sweden on debut and he's likely capable of better; trainer has had winners in the UAE down the years and this one is another to monitor closely.

runners.comment: Won on rules debut at Jebel Ali; should improve but needs a big step forward
runners.name: Duke Of Immatin
runners.spotlight: Third in a Meydan trial before winning on his rules debut over this trip at Jebel Ali; likely capable of better but he'll need to be if he's to follow up in this much stronger event.

runners.breeder: Fred W Hertrich Iii & Robert L Tribbet
runners.comment: Much improved to win at Lingfield last time; can do better but has to show he handles dirt
runners.name: Knight Of Glory
runners.spotlight: Stepped up considerably on form of debut effort when beating a subsequent winner at Lingfield in November; should do better again but ability to handle dirt has to be taken on trust.

runners.comment: Created a fine impression when winning over C&D on rules debut; likely to run well
runners.name: Lino Padrino
runners.owner: Suited & Booted - My Future Champions Racing
runners.spotlight: Won trial at this venue and created a fine impression when winning over C&D on rules debut; that form yet to be properly tested but he's a powerful individual who is probably capable of a good deal better; leading claims for in-form yard.

runners.comment: Won dirt maiden at Jebel Ali but runner-up and third have been well beaten since
runners.name: Rakaan
runners.spotlight: Beaten in his trial at this venue but showed a good attitude to win 6f maiden at Jebel Ali; however, runner-up and third have been well beaten since and this one needs to raise game.

runners.comment: Turned over at short price on his rules debut but made amends last time and should stay 7f
runners.name: Six Speed
runners.owner: Blue Blood Racing Syndicate - Kamlesh Mahtani & Dhruv Sahni
runners.spotlight: Trial winner who was turned over at a short price on rules debut; however, made amends when scoring over 6f last time and should stay this trip; gives trainer a strong hand.

runners.comment: Useful on turf in Britain but well beaten on UAE/dirt debut; good deal more needed
runners.name: Tailgunner Joe
runners.spotlight: Useful form at best in Britain but well beaten over 1m on UAE/dirt debut last month; considerably more needed in first-time blinkers if he's to figure at the finish.

runners.comment: Won well over 6f here on rules debut but disappointed last time; can do better
runners.name: Union Security
runners.spotlight: Won well over 6f (Six Speed in third) on rules debut in November but disappointing - as was the case with a couple from this yard around that time - last month; stable back among the winners and no surprise to see him fare better; should stay 7f.

runners.breeder: Sequel Stallions New York Llc & Scott Miller Farms Llc
runners.comment: Caught the eye on rules debut and should be suited by 7f but big step forward needed
runners.name: Al Khawaneej
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in a trial and caught the eye with his finishing effort over 6f behind Six Speed; step up to this trip (and beyond) will likely suit but needs a big step up form-wise if he's to figure.

runners.comment: Respectable effort in a trial but faces a tough task in this company on his rules debut
runners.name: Almutanabbi
runners.spotlight: Not far behind subsequent rules winner Rakaan in a trial in October but he faces a tough task in this company on his rules debut.

runners.breeder: Hill N Dale Equine Holdings, Inc & Stretch Run Ventures, Llc
runners.comment: Has shown ability at an ordinary level but would be a surprise winner from wide draw
runners.name: Kahrman
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability at an ordinary level so far but held by Lino Padrino on latest C&D form and looks up against it from widest draw on only 4lb better terms.

runners.comment: Respectable efforts on his two rules starts; gets cheekpieces but plenty more needed
runners.name: Marsood
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on form of rules debut when third to Six Speed over 6f last time; tried in cheekpieces for this step up in distance but good deal more needed.

runners.breeder: Scott K Pierce & Equine Futures, Llc
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both starts and looks up against it on these terms
runners.name: Rugby Union
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on both starts and up against it on these terms.

runners.comment: Hint of ability in a trial but soundly beaten on his rules debut and makes no appeal
runners.name: Victory Reigns
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.spotlight: Hint of ability in a trial but soundly beaten on his rules debut and makes no appeal.

runners.comment: Reserve: half-brother to a Breeders' Cup Turf Sprint winner; up against it on rules debut
runners.name: Yasup
runners.spotlight: Reserve: half-brother to Breeders' Cup Turf Sprint winner Shisospicy; hinted at ability in a trial but faces a tough task in this company on rules debut.

runners.comment: Clear career best when 3rd in 2022 Dubai Gold Cup but very little in just 3 runs since
runners.name: Al Madhar
runners.spotlight: Fourth in the Dubai City Of Gold in 2022 before a clear career best in the Dubai Gold Cup; however, just three runs since and tailed off here when last seen 301 days ago; new yard and well-being has to be taken on trust.

runners.comment: Dual purpose performer but well held on last couple of Flat runs at Pattern level
runners.name: Burdett Road
runners.spotlight: Dual purpose performer who finished third in an Arkle trial at Kempton last time out; well held in his last couple of Flat runs, both at Pattern level; would need to be right back at his best to take this.

runners.comment: Struggling off low marks in handicaps and no chance at these weights
runners.name: City King
runners.spotlight: Struggling off low marks in handicaps and no chance at these weights.

runners.comment: Possibly didn't stay on only previous try at 1m6f and has a huge amount to find on ratings
runners.name: Deciduous
runners.spotlight: Third in 1m3f Abu Dhabi handicap; possibly didn't stay on only previous try at this trip and has a huge amount to find on ratings.

runners.comment: Career best 2nd in Newmarket h'cap and lightly-raced for 5yo; unexposed
runners.name: Endless Victory
runners.spotlight: Career best when runner-up in a Newmarket handicap when last seen in July and he's lightly-raced for a five-year-old; unexposed at this trip and has to be high on the shortlist.

runners.comment: 2 encouraging placed efforts for new connections but this demands clear career best
runners.name: Flying Honours
runners.owner: Sheikh Abdul Aziz Bin Humaid Al Nuaimi
runners.spotlight: Two encouraging placed efforts here already this season for new connections; however, this demands a career best and needs to prove he's as effective at this trip.

runners.breeder: 2 0E A R L Haras Des Senora
runners.comment: Listed class and narrowly denied in Gr 2 last year; didn't figure in 3 runs here last term
runners.name: Goya Senora
runners.spotlight: Listed class in France and was only narrowly denied in five-runner Group 2 at Deauville in August; also went close in Listed company in October but he failed to figure in three runs here last term.

runners.comment: Dual purpose performer and 2nd in 2024 Ebor but may find a few too good here
runners.name: Kihavah
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose performer who arrives on the back of a career best over hurdles; arguably even better on the Flat and finished runner-up in 2024 Ebor over this trip (eighth last season); likely to find a few too good here though.

runners.comment: Dual Listed winner in 2024; respected but off 301 days and Buick ignores; non-runner
runners.name: King Of Conquest
runners.spotlight: Dual Listed winner in 2024 and three big runs in defeat over C&D last term before a Group 3 third at Bahrain over 1m4f; warrants respect but off 301 days and Buick prefers Endless Victory; non-runner.

runners.comment: Winless in 2025 but career best 3rd in Kempton Gr 3; return to that level gives him claims
runners.name: Meydaan
runners.spotlight: Fourth in 2024's Queen's Vase over this trip; failed to get his head back in front last year at trips ranging from 1m to 2m; didn't get his ground when tenth in the Melbourne Cup but posted a career best with a third in the September Stakes before his stint in Australia; return to that level of form could be good enough.

runners.comment: No wins since 2022 and hasn't been threatening at a much lesser level to this
runners.name: New Comedy
runners.owner: Ahmed Ebrahim Bin Aamer Al Shemeili
runners.spotlight: No wins since 2022 and hasn't been threatening at a much lesser level.

runners.comment: 1m4f winner here two seasons ago; not at that level in two runs for these connections
runners.name: Ruling Dynasty
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner here a couple of seasons ago; not at that level in two runs for these connections and best watched for now.

runners.comment: Just a maiden win but career best Ascot 2nd latest; 320,000gns purchase since; needs more
runners.name: Nightwalker
runners.spotlight: Just a maiden success to his name but posted a career best when beaten a neck at Ascot in October over this trip in a first-time hood (retained); bought for 320,000gns in the interim but needs to step up on his Ascot form to land this.

runners.breeder: Mount Coote Estates & Mr F Karothy
runners.name: Juantorena

runners.comment: Ran well over 5f here following a break last time and likely to go well back up in trip
runners.name: Roman Dragon
runners.spotlight: All wins have either been at this track or at Chester and he ran well over 5f here following a break of over three months last time; return to 6f no problem and should go well.

runners.comment: Best effort when bolting up over C&D last time; up 12lb but can't be ruled out
runners.name: Burdett
runners.spotlight: Career-best effort when bolting up over this C&D in November; 12lb higher mark demands more but interesting to see if that effort can be backed up.

runners.comment: Off mark over 7f in November and respectable run last time but more needed down in trip
runners.name: Chandigah
runners.spotlight: Has been trained in Ireland/UAE but bagged first win over 7f at this venue in maiden in November; respectable effort in Listed event last time but likely vulnerable back in trip and back in handicap.

runners.comment: Encouraging Bahrain debut in local Group 2; interesting to see if that can be built on
runners.name: Ramazan
runners.spotlight: Smart performer for Richard Fahey but mainly disappointing in Britain in 2025; more encouragement on Bahrain debut in local Group 2 and interesting to see if he can build on that back in a handicap.

runners.comment: Should be better for last month's run (first since early 2024) but he has plenty to prove
runners.name: Dairerin
runners.spotlight: Has won from 5f-7f but, while he should be all the better for last month's 5f run here (his first outing since February 2024), he has to show how much ability he retains.

runners.comment: Won over both sprint distances in Bahrain and respectable efforts of late; each-way shot
runners.name: Qaseem
runners.spotlight: 6f winner for Karl Burke in Britain and has won over both sprint distances in Bahrain; respectable efforts this season and won't mind the return to 6f; each-way prospect.

runners.comment: In good form, winning over both sprint distances in Bahrain; more to do back in handicap
runners.name: Redemption Time
runners.spotlight: Back to winning ways over 5f in November and followed up from 4lb higher mark over this trip in local Group 2; mark unchanged but more to do back in handicap company.

runners.comment: Hasn't won since 2023 and below best when last seen but on a good mark for Bahrain debut
runners.name: Commanche Falls
runners.owner: Doug Graham, Ian Davison, Alan Drysdale
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won since September 2023 and below best at York when last seen in October but has slipped to a handy mark and unlikely to mind conditions; one to keep an eye on for Bahrain debut.

runners.comment: Fairly reliable yardstick; hasn't been out since April and may find one or two too good
runners.name: Inveigle
runners.spotlight: Fairly reliable yardstick who ran respectably in local Group 1 over C&D when last seen in April; should give it best shot but may find a couple of these too good.

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Triple winner for the Meade stable and has won in Doha; best watched following a break
runners.name: Auditor
runners.spotlight: Triple winner for the Meade stable in Britain in 2021/22 but only win since came in Doha; hasn't been seen since January and looks one to watch for this Bahrain debut.

runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate Iii
runners.comment: 6f debut winner in Britain; ran well over 5f on Bahrain debut; claims back up in distance
runners.name: Dubai Bling
runners.spotlight: 6f debut winner in Britain and ran well on Bahrain debut when third to Kendall Roy and stable companion Roman Dragon; may reverse placings with the runner-up back up in trip.

runners.comment: Second in 2025 Lincoln and may find one or two too quick over this trip on fast ground
runners.name: Oliver Show
runners.spotlight: Has won four times over 7f and 1m and turned in best effort in last year's Lincoln at Doncaster; respectable effort at same course on first run over this trip (heavy) but may find a few of these too quick on Bahrain debut.

runners.comment: Multiple winner but hasn't scored since early 2023 and may find one or two too strong
runners.name: Rebel At Dawn
runners.spotlight: Multiple sprint winner in Britain and in Bahrain but has had a few chances since last win in early 2023; divided Qaseem and Redemption Time in local Group 1 on reappearance but work to do if he's to win back in handicap,

runners.comment: Shaped well over 5f here two weeks ago and no problem with the return to this trip; claims
runners.name: Desert Cop
runners.spotlight: 5f winner at this venue last season and shaped encouragingly back in Bahrain when close fourth to Kendall Roy over 5f; no problem with this longer trip and he's shortlisted.

runners.comment: Respectable effort on Bahrain debut last time but may find one or two too good back at 6f
runners.name: Rocking Ends
runners.spotlight: Has won over 6f but ideally suited by 5f on a sound surface and ran respectably on Bahrain debut two weeks ago; may find one or two too strong back up in distance, though.

runners.comment: Notched four consecutive wins in Britain in late summer but needs to better Bahrain debut
runners.name: Another Baar
runners.spotlight: Notched four consecutive wins in Britain in late summer and has won over this trip; however, below best on Bahrain debut last time (held by several of these) and he's one to watch.

runners.comment: Improved sprinter last year; below best on Bahrain debut but return to 6f should suit
runners.name: Chief Mankato
runners.spotlight: Improved sprinter in summer but hasn't been at best on last two starts but the return to this trip should be in his favour and no surprise should be put in a better showing.

runners.comment: Well beaten back in Bahrain recently; return to 6f in favour but considerably more needed
runners.name: Spangled Mac
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Adrian Mcalpine
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last January and has been running well in Britain; however, below best behind Kendall Roy over 5f here last time; return to 6f should suit but he's probably one to watch.

runners.comment: Four-time winner in Bahrain but well beaten last two starts best watched again
runners.name: Kaasib
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner in Bahrain, including over C&D in October but has struggled from a 13lb higher mark since; has been dropped 3lb but others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Reserve: hasn't won for nearly two years and well beaten on yard debut when last seen
runners.name: Buffer Zone
runners.spotlight: Reserve: hasn't had much racing since last win in local Group 2 over C&D in February 2024; well beaten on first run for trainer when last seen in April and easy to overlook.

runners.comment: Reserve: triple winner for Jedd O'Keefe and went for 170,000gns in October; interesting
runners.name: Dan Tucker
runners.spotlight: Reserve: triple winner for Jedd O'Keefe and purchased for 170,000gns in October; type to do well in Bahrain and one to keep an eye on.

runners.comment: Reserve: form patchy since last win in 2024 and needs to raise game if he's to figure
runners.name: Grand City Hall
runners.spotlight: Reserve: form patchy since last win in 2024 (Ireland) and needs to better form of last two starts if he's to figure this time.

16:40.race_name: Al Dana Cup sponsored by Al Salam Bank (Handicap) (4yo+) (Outer Track) (Turf)

runners.comment: Improved form on stable/Bahrain debut last month; up 8lb but likely to run well
runners.name: Nesthorn
runners.spotlight: Improved form when winning over 1m2f from wide draw on stable/Bahrain debut last month; up 8lb and down in trip but isn't fully exposed and no surprise to see him go well, despite another double-figure draw.

runners.comment: Second to Nesthorn on Bahrain debut but wouldn't be certain to back that up this time
runners.name: Hi Royal
runners.spotlight: Second to Nesthorn on Bahrain debut last time and again better drawn than that rival; weighted to get closer but form has been uneven since sole success in 2022 and may again find one or two too good.

runners.comment: C&D winner last January and encouraging reappearance but below best on his last two runs
runners.name: Merlins Beard
runners.spotlight: Won Turf Series handicap over C&D nearly a year ago; shaped as though retaining much of his ability over 1m on reappearance; below that level since (behind Nesthorn last time) and work to do from stall 15.

runners.comment: Triple winner in 2021 but not seen for nearly three years and can only be watched
runners.name: Recovery Run
runners.spotlight: Won at Ascot and twice in Bahrain in 2021 but not seen since March 2023 and easy to swerve on first run for this trainer.

runners.comment: Has run well in local Group races in Bahrain; more to do from wide draw back in handicap
runners.name: Intricacy
runners.spotlight: Triple winner for the Crisfords and has run well in local Group races on two of last three starts in Bahrain; cheekpieces refitted but more to do back in trip from wide draw returned to handicaps.

runners.comment: Returned to form in face of stiff task last time but up 7lb and not won for a long time
runners.name: Mehmento
runners.spotlight: Returned to form in the face of a stiff task in Listed event behind Byline but raised 7lb for that and it's a long time since he's won a race; best watched back in handicap company.

runners.comment: Running respectably but has a bit to find at the weights with Nesthorn and Hi Royal
runners.name: Rollajam
runners.spotlight: Hasn't had many chances since last win but respectable efforts on last two starts; however, he'll have to step up if he's to reverse recent Turf Series placings with Nesthorn and Hi Royal.

runners.comment: Wide-margin 1m4f winner last February but not matched that since; work to do from draw
runners.name: Signalman
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin 1m4f winner last February but hasn't matched that since and he'll have to raise his game if he's to return to winning ways from double-figure draw.

runners.comment: In good form towards the end of last season but plenty to find with Nesthorn on last run
runners.name: Salamanca Lad
runners.spotlight: In good form towards the end of last season but below best both outings this season and plenty to find with Nesthorn and Hi Royal on latest Turf Series running.

runners.comment: Soft-ground winner in Ireland but yet to score in Bahrain; more needed back in handicap
runners.name: Vestigia
runners.spotlight: Dual soft-ground winner in Ireland but yet to win in Bahrain; closely matched with Intricacy on latest run in local Group 1 but more needed back in handicap over this shorter trip.

runners.comment: 1m4f winner in March but effective at 1m1f and should be better for stable/Bahrain debut
runners.name: Max Mayhem
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner at Meydan in March but effective over this trip and better than the distance beaten from double-figure draw on Bahrain debut last time; better drawn this time and no surprise to see him run well.

runners.breeder: Minster Stud And Mrs H Dalgety
runners.comment: Progressive sort who has won both starts in Bahrain; up 7lb and stall 16 makes life tough
runners.name: Hot Dancer
runners.spotlight: Had a good time of it in 2025 with four wins and is 2-2 in Bahrain; up 7lb but, although he's the type to take his form to a higher level, stall 16 draw makes life tougher.

runners.comment: In good form this season and ran well in Turf Series handicap last time; should go well
runners.name: Phoenix Passion
runners.spotlight: In good form this season and posted a solid effort when third to Nesthorn and Hi Royal over 1m2f last time; back in trip and drawn wider but isn't without a chance.

runners.comment: Multiple winner in Ireland but below best here in 2023/24 season and below best in autumn
runners.name: Slieve Binnian
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner in Ireland but wasn't at his best in Bahrain in the 2023/24 season; below best when last seen in autumn and may be one to watch this time.

runners.comment: Ran well given he was repeatedly denied a run in the straight on Bahrain debut; player
runners.name: Cloud Seeker
runners.spotlight: Has won five times in Ireland and ran respectably from stall 13 behind Nesthorn on Bahrain debut, despite being short of room for much of the straight; no surprise to see him go close.

runners.comment: Dual 1m2f winner at York last year but proved disappointing on Bahrain debut last time
runners.name: Dain Ma Nut In
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m2f winner at York last year but cut out quickly and finished tailed off on Bahrain debut; that's worth forgiving but he's probably best watched this time.

runners.comment: Won Turf Series handicap last March and interesting on stable debut back here
runners.name: Soldiers Empire
runners.spotlight: Turned in best effort in Bahrain when winning Turf Series handicap in March but failed to match that level back in Britain; interesting to see how he gets on back in Bahrain on stable debut.

runners.comment: Reserve: wasn't at best in Turf Series handicap last time and others make more appeal
runners.name: Gulmarg
runners.spotlight: Reserve: down the field behind Soldier's Empire in Turf Series handicap in March but beaten a long way behind Nesthorn last time and may again find one or two too good.

runners.comment: Reserve: dual winner in France but below best in Bahrain this season; best watched
runners.name: Azka
runners.spotlight: Reserve: dual winner in France but hasn't been at best so far this season and others appeal more.

runners.comment: Reserve: won over 7f on Bahrain debut; up in weights/trip but more to come
runners.name: Love Is The Law
runners.spotlight: Reserve: triple winner in Britain who turned in best effort when winning over 7f on Bahrain debut last time; up in weights over the longest trip she's tackled and likely there's more to come.
